Reviews.Title: “Not just great Granola!”
Reviews.Author: travelkaze
Reviews.Content: Overall, great vibe, fab location, near great restaurants and shopping! Imperial No 9 very good, some wait staff inexperienced and not always attentive however, others went above and beyond. We loved their house granola and on our last day, much to our delight and surprise, were presented with some to take home with us by the hostess who was amazing. Last minute Broadway tix were procured easily, thank you, it made our stay extra special, and with 2 teenagers, even they were impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Great views, great location, great vibe”
Reviews.Author: stomachdoc
Reviews.Content: Played hooky with my wife for a couple of days in NYC. Great location in Soho. Very friendly staff at check-in and throughout our stay. Were upgraded to a suite, wall of glass overlooking the city--fantastic! The bed was comfortable and the room came with an iPad for accessing hotel services, information. The room had some scratched paint from furniture/chairs being moved and the light colored couch was showing some dirt/stains, but this was all really minor. All in all, would highly recommend the Mondrian.

Reviews.Title: “If Hotel W is a Terrier, Mondrian is a Poodle”
Reviews.Author: Keithcu
Reviews.Content: ...but a nice poodle. The most striking thing about this hotel is its color (white and blue predominantly) and flamboyance (think big, fluffy feathers). I couldn't believe the pictures on the website were for real, but they were. I found it a little silly but secretly kinda liked it (not so secret any more). -- The hotel is well located in SoHo just off of Broadway -- we had a pleasant walk from battery park in less than 30 minutes. -- The rooms are small but well appointed and functional. I liked the large shower, comfortable bed, and window that actually opens. The desk and sink were really squeezed in making it hard to use either effectively. -- The room boasts lots of technology. You get an iPad, but it didn't appear to have an Internet browser loaded (huh?) and an iPod dock, but I couldn't get mine to work. Internet will cost you, which is one of my big pet peeves. The flat screen TV had as many channels as I have at home -- bravo! Overall, the Mondrian is to be recommended for anyone looking to stay in SoHo or points south.

Reviews.Title: “Artsy with little function”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: Let me say that the location is OK if traveling up the east side or central Manhattan as the appropriate trains are right there off canal but if venturing up the West side, those canal street trains(1-2-3-4 or A-C-E) are a decent walk away and not really convenient. Arrived prior to family with 4 LARGE bags for the week, the hotel has a funky gardeny entrance that sets the actual front door 25 yards off the curb, no bell man in sight to help and as I approached the door he finally appears after chatting it up with others at entrance>> this is likely a management issue rather than bell issue, with that distance from curb to door you simply need to make sure there is always someone on curb,,,at ~$400/nt that expectation is minimum I suspect, even if its just to flag a cab. Rather than running to flag a cab my wife was urged to do so,,,see the $400/nt comment above. Crosby is a side street so catching a cab there is likely not happening unless you are catching a cab after a drop off. Desk staff, especially Catie were awesome and super accommodating, Kelly in restaurant same thing,,just really friendly and nice. Joey, our exiting bell man was great, lugged a ton of stuff for us and packed the car. Room was clean, fresh, cool as you'd expect from Mondrian, the only watch out is staying there with 3 in room gets tight and also the major issue is the translucent bathroom door, morning comes quickly as the shower is really a clear window to the world as well which turns the lights on well earlier than we'd like. Not sure that every room has the same door, I'd ask if you enjoy sleeping in on vacation. Food in restaurant was very good, just couldn't get up to eat it more than once. If returning to area I may stay again if alone or with wife only, tough call, we were lucky with good weather for walking etc otherwise getting to trains and cabs would be a major issue. With other Luxury near by and Sheraton Tribeca around the corner for value not sure I'd do Mondrian again. Also this was a business and pleasure trip,,,poor for business in room, just not equipped as many of the hipster places are not for business. Weird, got free wi-fi for a day or so and then charge screen appears to get charged??

Reviews.Title: “So hip in Soho”
Reviews.Author: Justin C
Reviews.Content: Not far from the Holland Tunnel, we wove our way into Soho in search of the Mondrian Hotel, where we had reservations. On our first pass down Crosby, we missed the place. From ground level, it's easy to do. The signage is small and hard to spot from a car. That's the beginning and end of my complaining. Signage on this ultra-modern, upscale property should be more prominent on both Crosby and Lafayette. This would certainly help with walk-in restaurant business. But once we found our way and got up to our 21st-floor room, we knew we were in a special place. The Mondrian has a cool, hip vibe from the low lighting to the stark colors to the ceiling-to-floor windows in the guest rooms. We had a 180-view of Lower Manhattan. Gorgeous, especially at sunset. The amenities are what you'd expect in an upscale brand though our room wasn't spacious. Still, it was comfortable and pleasant to be in. The real draw here is the location -- in Soho within a few blocks of Little Italy and Chinatown. Two-minute walk to a subway stop that will take you wherever you need to go. Fabulous shops and restaurants within an easy stroll. This is a great, convenient hotel location for business or leisure travel. Just one thing -- make the signs bigger at street level so people know it's there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: K C
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel from March 11th to March 14th 2012. The hotel is in a fantastic location and we were greeted with smiles from the cute bell boys. The decor is very cool and still feels warm, especially the restaurant at the entrance. The lobby is on the second floor which is inconvenient. The staff at the front desk were nice but didn't explain anything about the services offered or the Ipad that comes with the room (which was great) but we had to call and ask a million questions that should have been answered before they were asked. The room was small, king bed on the 23rd floor but the bright light and amazing views made up for it. The bed was really comfortable and I would stay there again.... but not eat there... the room service for 2 burgers and water was $77.

Reviews.Title: “Great - if a little noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Johnnythirkell
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel which is let down by the paper-thin walls. Decor is quite funky (maybe even trying a little too hard?) but the staff are first class. Very attentive and professional. My room was a deluxe and, although it was nicely appointed and bright and airy, it was a little on the small side. However, the whole place is let down by the fact that you can pretty much hear every word being said in the next room - especially if you have two excitable girls next door intent on discussing their respective boyfriends. If it weren't for that I would have given it a 5. This is the third time I have stayed there though, so it can't be that bad!

Reviews.Title: “best room service menu”
Reviews.Author: sasnhe
Reviews.Content: The room is small but sensually designed with a great shower, comfortable bed and many interesting adult items available on the room service menu. Because the hotel is on the upper floors of the building, there are great views of New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MayaJohnny
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and really great spot if you want to explore the city. Really close to the subway - in a great neighborhood, close to lots of nightlife. The hotel is extremely modern, with really helpful and friendly staff. The rooms are extremely comfortable with cool extras like an iPad in the room that you can use to find stuff to do while in NY. Only drawback was that the rooms were kind of small, but that really wasn't too big of a deal. Overall, awesome hotel, highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly, but a case of style over function?”
Reviews.Author: thatblokeDon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week while my wife was on a business trip and I was on a break, so we experienced the hotel as a business traveller and holiday guest at the same time. On both counts the hotel met our needs, though on both counts it also fell a little short. Highlights: - Great location, right in the middle of SoHo. Easy to get uptown, downtown and everywhere else. - Very friendly staff. Good service as you would expect. - Great bed, great pillows (very important), and very clean. The amount of blue in the room and hotel can be a bit overpowering at times though. - Good view if you get a room on a higher floor. - Quality TV and sound system with ipod/iphone dock. - iPads in the rooms for guests to use. - Decor was nice but might not be to everyone's taste. Questionable: - The design of the rooms. Don't know what the other rooms are like but ours was a strange design with very thin walls. The bathroom is basically screened off rather than walled off so privacy could be an issue for couples who are just getting to know each other, if you know what I mean, plus you can hear other guests sometimes. - The entrance way to our room was a wasted space where they decided to place the bathroom sink. Hmmm. - All rooms have a shower instead of a bath. Apparently you can ask for a room with a bath so remember to do so if you want one. - Our room had a tiny table so if you want to do some work in the room it can be a little difficult to spread out. - Room service prices. I don't know what the prices are like at other hotels but $50 for a simple breakfast of fruit, eggs and coffee seems a little steep to me. Tips: - Ask for a higher room. - Ask for a room with a bath if you want one. - If on a business trip, don't expect to be able to work in your room too much as the tables are tiny. - Eat out. There are plenty of amazing restaurants within walking distance of the hotel that are much cheaper than room service. Conclusion: A very cool hotel in a great location. Not the best room but definitely does the job, and the beds are fantastic. The hotel bars downstairs attract a hip crowd that can be a little too cool for school, but hey, that's New York.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed the Mondrian Soho”
Reviews.Author: dramamama56
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night while in the city -- and are so glad we did. The room had a wonderful view (thank you for the complementary upgrade to the 21st floor). The white with blue accents theme is so restful, comfortable bed, spotless contemporary room. Thoroughly enjoyed and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Jeninyc967
Reviews.Content: I just checked out from the Mondrian Soho after an extended stay so I had a chance to really get a feel for this hotel. Realy great location tucked into a quiet street in Soho. Super, super staff - genuinely friendly, very professional, really helpful and nice. There was zero attitude at the Mondrian. They were there for you if you needed something - but not too over the top. Perfect balance. I had a great room over looking the city with a backdrop of the Hudson - very clean. The gym is compact and offers everything for a full workout. The restaurant has a beautiful atrium - and on Saturday afternoons offers live music. Great Saturday lunch spot. Love the breakfast and lunch menu. I completely would recommend the Mondrian Soho to friends and business associates coming to NYC. I travel extensively around the States and OUS - I now would look for a Mondrian property first. Thanks for a super stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great great Great trip”
Reviews.Author: jbwheat4
Reviews.Content: We planned a quick trip to NYNY to celebrate my birthday. We decided to stay in a different area for us, and chose this hotel, being familiar with the Clift, Mondrian Miami, etc. We requested any available 'special extras,' as it was an event. They went above and beyond, they gave us an upgrade, amenity, etc, etc, They were very nice in all areas, bellstaff, reception, concierge, restaurant, and lounge. We like it so much we are going back the first weekend of March for 3 nites!

Reviews.Title: “Great location , friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: YHZTelAviv
Reviews.Content: Hi - Its a new hotel in Soho ,AAA location, just off Broadway ,The rooms are good size for NYC (book the king size room) , great and helpful reception team ,nice & small GYM ,Hip bar .reasonable rates for Soho.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: MellieBe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mondrian for 3 nights in January. I was offered a complimentary upgrade to a suite - the room was just fabulous (spacious, clean, everything I needed). The service was impeccable and you can't beat the location. A wonderful stay and look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “small & chic”
Reviews.Author: onejkm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mondrian for two nights and it was perfect for a quick party weekend. The decor is girly and adorable, all silver and blue. The staff was most helpful from the time we arrived until the time we left. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service!”
Reviews.Author: Andre W
Reviews.Content: I honestly can't say anything bad about the service I received from this Hotel. as a hospitality student at Roosevelt University I am exceptionally critical of properties, but they delivered great results on a constant basis. The staff was EXTREMELY friendly and competent. I changed rooms to upgrade and they were more than willing to assist me. In addition, the place is REALLY well decorated. The restaurant is one of the most beautifully decorated places I have ever seen. It was like a palace. Finally, the location is the most ideal. It's truly the best location because of proximity to the subway, great food and great shopping. I woud stay here EVERY time I come to visit NYC

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: agnes188
Reviews.Content: We just came back from an excellent stay at the Mondrian. Our expectations were fairly high due to fab reviews, and every single expectation was met. The staff were incredibly polite & friendly dressed in relaxed outfits (jeans, trainers). We had a room with the most amazing views from the room and bathroom (how often can you see the Empire State whilst having a shower?)....and we loved the in room ipad! The overall decor is beautiful and quirky and the restaurant/bar is like an amazing indoor garden. There is a laid back non imposing atmosphere, I wish all luxury hotels were like this one and location is perfect, bang in the middle of Soho super close to Excellent shopping, restaurants and walking distance to many great places - we will def come back and have already started to recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Hipster at Its Best”
Reviews.Author: cupecoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (who are both in our 40s) stayed here overnight mid-week after Christmas. The entrance to the hotel is lovely--a long ivy-covered tunnel, with limited signage, so it pays to know the exact location ahead of time. It is a very brief walk from several subway lines. The "lobby" is small and looks like a somewhat disorganized parlor from "Alice in Wonderland," complete with furry lamps, velvet upholstery, and ornate dining chairs haphazardly strewn about. I kept having to look out for the heavy metallic dining chair that always seemed to be sitting awkwardly in the most direct route from the elevator to the front door. There is a small concierge desk in the lobby but no indication of the elevators or a registration desk. The elevators are located in an alcove hidden from view in back of the lobby. All the reviews that talk about the dark elevators are absolutely correct. It is so dark in the elevators that you have to be sure to push your floor's button before the doors close and you have no light, because the buttons only light up when pushed. While many of the other details of the hotel seem like borderline hipster silliness, this detail is way over the line into complete silliness. However, this detail can be overlooked by the wonderful rooms. Yes, the rooms are indeed small, but the decor is fabulous. The minimalist blue and white paint and white bed linens gives the room a light, airy feel despite its small size. The floor to ceiling windows also afford terrific views and expand the vistas of the room. The room is designed for maximum efficiency without sacrificing luxury. We had a deluxe king room. The marble shower was high end and large enough for two (even three possibly :-). The toiletries were Malin and Goetz and were a nice touch. The wet bar also had a small pharmacy tray stocked with essentials such as a "mile high kit" and ibuprofen. No standard plain water glasses, cut crystal stems were de rigeuer. What else can I say? There were no noise issues whatsoever. The heating/HVAC worked wonderfully. The location was very convenient to South Broadway shopping and Chinatown. Many terrific restaurants were in easy walking distance. If you want to catch a cab, exit the back entrance onto Lafayette--tons of cabs available. All of the staff, every single person we met who worked there, was unfailing pleasant and wished us a good stay. I don't think I've ever stayed in a hotel with such a gracious staff.. In the end, while my husband and I felt a little old for the hipster vibe of the hotel, it was fun and a little campy. Definitely high-end hipster.

Reviews.Title: “very small room but beautiful view and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ECO_minnie
Reviews.Content: Good - perfect location, - great view of downtown Manhattan if you are on the higher floor(i was on 24th) - kind door man - very neat and modern interior Bad -really really really small room and the bathroom (but organized neatly) - wifi was not working on my computer/ mine worked totally fine in other hotels i stayed the day before and after - I am not sure of the service of the front desk people, they said they will find out about the two beds room but never got back to us/ the phone didn't work in the beginning so I had to go down to the front desk whenever I had problem and they didn't say sorry/ internet didn't work so I went down to tell them and they asked me to bring it down again (really?)

Reviews.Title: “Form over function”
Reviews.Author: tktchr
Reviews.Content: Pretty but completely nonfunctional. The conference room on the lobby level runs hot and cold. Literally. One minute I'm freezing and the next minute I'm sweating. There are weird stretchy cloths on the conference tables that look cool but are incredibly annoying because you can't stretch out your legs. The water's supposed to come on automatically in the bathroom but sometimes I stand there trying to figure out how to get it to come on. I felt like I needed a flashlight to find the right floor in the elevator panel. It feels like someone designed the hotel, looked to make sure it looked cool, but didn't try anything out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: AMHunton
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 2 nights at this great hotel. Amazing views, cool furnishings and great Soho location, just near the canal st metro stop. We booked a standard king, but had a room on 24th floor, so the view from the ceiling to floor windows was to die for. The room size is more than enough for 2 nights, tiny bathroom, but clean and really, do you need to spend too much time in your room in NYC? I don't think so. what they had was modern, trendy and chic! I'd stay again, a real treat would be in the summer where they have a great outdoor bar/restaurant. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Retreat in Soho”
Reviews.Author: seeingtheworld22
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a one night getaway to NYC thru Priceline after Christmas so I got a good deal. This hotel is very comfortable and off the street. They're going with a blue and white design so it's very appropriate during the holidays. Our room was small but adequate. The king sized bed was great, they provide you with an iPad, which is great when scoping out places nearby to eat, the shower was great and we had a nice floor to ceiling window, which makes the room seem bigger than it really is and we had great views of the city! The location is great - right in Soho and next to Little Italy and Canal Street. The metros are only a couple of blocks away. Overall, this is a great hidden gem in Soho.

Reviews.Title: “blue blue blue.”
Reviews.Author: ap0k
Reviews.Content: had a great stay at the mondrian soho. surprisingly not noisy considering the clientele( corner room ) pros: - location is phenomenal. if you like to shop, drink and be near chinatown, this place is perfect. - very hip, cool rooms and decor with ipads inside( for hotel amenities ). - actually way cheaper than the standard, which i consider a peer. - bell service people are super helpful - is it me or is everyone who works here super hot? cons: - small rooms( but everywhere in NYC is ) - water main broke in the room next to us, so the hall was a bit wet. hopefully a temporal thing.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure in SoHo”
Reviews.Author: caribartTT
Reviews.Content: Planned on spending Christmas and New Years in New York City rather than the Cairbbean where I live... No IM not crazy, just a change of pace. I usually stay in the midtown/Times Square area whenever I visit the city, but not this time. Wanted to try something different. I got a great "advance purchase" deal as a member of Tablet Hotels and booked 2 rooms for our 11 nights stay. Upon arrival, we were greeted with a wonderful smile and courteous reception of the doorman who took our luggage and showed us the way to the lobby on the 1st floor. Easy check in and we even took advantage of a room upgrade to a suite for another USD80.00 per night. I figured our deal was so good, that I could add on the room upgrade and be comfortable in a larger room. All NYC hotel rooms are small. Loved the room, the cal or harmony in the room with the crisp white contrasting with the royal blue. Bed was probably one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in. There were ample drawers in the dresser and bed to unpack and put away our clothes. The only thing the is no space for the empty bags which I wished I could store for the 11 nights. But we made it work. Our room was a King Suite with separate sitting area, floor to ceiling glass windows looking west over Crosby Street with a glimpse of the Hudson River. The shower was a bit voyeuristic with a big glass window to the city. I don't know what kind of peep show I was providing for 11 nights. But I was not arrested. House cleaning staff were thorough and non-invasive and courteous. The dining room at Imperial No. 9 is beautiful. Rustic and elegant at the same time. A Garden Green House with crystal chandeliers, best suited for an organic/farm to table restaurant. But it is not. The menu is seafood and we did dine there for one dinner and 2 breakfasts during our stay. Very peculiar food, unappealing plating and outright unappetizing. What a pity. Thankfully we are in SoHo and there was ample dining choices all around with amazing food. We did a Thai Angel delivery to our room one rainy night. Excellent thai food from next door. Some restaurants I'd recommend which we ate at are: Certainly BALTHAZAR at Crosby/Spring for Breakfast, but try and make it before the crowds come from 9. Lunch are L'ECOLE Broadway/Grand, and then dinner at DAVID BURKE KITCHEN Thompson/Grand St, ABC KITCHEN 18th/Broadway, TAMARIND (Indian) Hudson/Franklin in Tribeca and as always a must do for us is always lunch in the dining room at THE MODERN at MOMA. Some misses for us was Kittichai, Gramercy Tavern, Chin Chin and Dim Sum at Oriental Garden. None of these lived up to the hype. Will review each later. The staff at all levels of the Mondrian Soho were wonderful. All the guys at the door, the concierge, the hostesses at Imperial No. 9, the Front Desk team and house-keeping. TO the manager of the hotel. Your team works in good harmony. The bonuses of a stay here were the in room IPAD with free Wifi (if you use your own computer and tablet you will have to pay for internet) Its great location on the fringe of Chinatown, Little Italy and in Southern SoHo. The location to walk to shops is perfect. Look forward to a future stay at this property

Reviews.Title: “where is the vent in the bathroom?”
Reviews.Author: linda_bp
Reviews.Content: Perfect service and very gentle employees. My room was really little. I do not like the idea of the sink in the bathroom; it reminds me the design of the early XX century rooms. I think it is a choice depending on the few available square feet. Furthermore in my bathroom there was no working vent; fact that doesn't make any sense. The shadowy entrance will be very cute in the hot New York summers. Although I like the boutique hotels, this one seems more suitable for Miami. This is my taste though.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful place to stay in SoH0”
Reviews.Author: sarahxxxAustralia
Reviews.Content: I was delighted by the SoHo Mondrian. The rooms are lovely but small (this is NYC so what do you expect). We were upgraded without asking which was fantastic. We had a corner room on level 16 and the view was amazing! The hotel is modern and funky - the bar is fantastic, the room service menu is interesting and delicious. We loved the service

Reviews.Title: “Not our cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveler32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mondrian Soho for one night, booked through Priceline for $175 for 3 people. Unfortunately, they gave us a room with only one bed, so we got charged another $60 to get a room with two double beds! Yes, they had an iPad in the room, but any info you may want (like where is the workout room?) has to be found on their website...which is not intuitive at all. We had a great view (16th floor) and the location in Soho is really nice, but we had a rotten taste in our mouth for getting charged extra. The bathroom door doesn't lock, and the shower had a door that didn't go wall-to-wall...I guess that's their "upscale" look. Couldn't use the workout room once I found out it was on the lower level, because the room was freezing cold. I can tell you that this is definitely not a 4-star hotel in our book...but some may like it more than we did. Our $175 room was really a $235 room, and definitely not worth it for us.

Reviews.Title: “In-line with the cost. Overly trendy at times”
Reviews.Author: mikeyp626
Reviews.Content: My overall rating isn't nearly as telling as my qualitative review below. Just a little background about myself, I lived in Manhattan for 5+ years and now live in the Back Bay area in Boston. I am an urbanite through and through and tend to like nice things although I wouldn't call myself extravagant by any means. If you are looking for a hotel for leisure in order to get the true NYC experience, this is it. Unfortunately, I was traveling to NYC for business and not for pleasure. This hotel has everything that you would look for in a true NY hotel - dim lighting, very trendy room, and very lively "scene" in the lobby of the hotel to get you in the mood. These are all things that I try to avoid on business as I just want to be comfortable and get a good nights rest. I found the dim lighting a little annoying and the close quarters/trendy set-up of the room was a little uncomfortable. Location was right in SoHo so no complaints there for the business or pleasure. This review may not be fair, but I hope it was helpful in making your decision on whether to stay here or not. It was a cool spot, but it wasn't the right spot for my particular purpose.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect style-lover's retreat”
Reviews.Author: suehax
Reviews.Content: From the thrill-inducing canopy over the entryway to the i-Pad equipped rooms to help you manage your room and stay, the Mondrain Hotel is a design-lovers treat. With lamps thats remind one of a Dr. Suess creation and a restaurant that is pure beauty, this style-conscious traveler was so happy being there, she almost didn't want to leave. But you must, as the hotel is located in very now South Soho. Surrounded by great retail and restaurants, it is also convenient to multiple subway lines a few blocks away on Canal Street. Staff was lovely, rooms small but luxe. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful & great staff, adorable hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Merllinn
Reviews.Content: Although we had a short stay (2 nights) we felt great at Mondrian Soho. Located about 300 m from Canal tube station, that takes you directly up to Central Park South (7th with 57th st), the hotel is located between Soho and Little Italy areas. Plenty restaurants if you wish to have dinner out, friendly area to walk even during the night and quietly located on a side street. Staff were extremely helpful and nice, among the friendliest I have ever met ;). The interior of the entire location (lobby, rooms, restaurant, even the elevators) is very chic and, although on blue, I found it very warm. There is no need to say that this is a very clean place. Again, big plus for the staff...

Reviews.Title: “Whimsical trendy atmosphere, great stay”
Reviews.Author: LANinaK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and had a great stay. The staff, every single one of them, was extremely friendly and helpful. The decor is whimsical and fun - lots of blue and white, feathered lamp shades, giant Alice In Wonderland-style mirrors everywhere. The restaurant with it's atrium glass roof and bird theme was beautiful. I only ate a small snack there but the menu selection was first rate. The scene on Saturday night was young and trendy, with a packed bar and club. The room we had (801) was small but comfortable and well organized. The wall of windows made it bright and friendly. The bed was very comfortable - I'm a sucker for big white comforters. The bathroom, with it's floor to ceiling frosted glass wall was also bright as well as clean and roomy for the size of the room partly because the sink was on the outside - sounds low rent but instead was a clever design. It's in a great location between Soho and Little Italy - on a quiet street yet in the middle of everything. My only complaint would be that the elevators were so dark. It was actually hard to see the buttons! I would definitely recommend it for someone looking for a boutique hotel feel and I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Supremely Accommodating Staff, Comfortable, Convenient, Trendy”
Reviews.Author: OSU_Sux
Reviews.Content: Had to spend the night on last minute's notice and the bell and front desk staff were terrifically accommodating and gracious. The lobby is beautiful, a bit confusing at first but creates its own intimacy and sense of "know" for the returning guest. Dined at the bar, bartender gave amazing dinner recommendations that are off the guidebooks, wish I had taken her name, she recommended Meatball Shack and Fish, went to the former, great great choice, highly recommend. The bar/restaurant is among the most pleasant for an evening honestly would have liked to have more time to hang out there. The rooms are comfortable but this is NYC and they are small. Too much junk is placed on the vanity and side tables, but all-in-all the closet takes care of storage needs. Bed is very comfortable, cool shower amenities, had never seen that brand before. Love the location because in SoHo of course, but also VERY convenient to the Canal Street subway line. Getting a taxi a little more challenging however. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly corridor/room”
Reviews.Author: Lenski123
Reviews.Content: The 8th floor where I was put smelled like the smell you get when you walk on the pavement and you pass the air vents from a restaurant - that smell of fat/gas/cooking/vinegar/ammonia. Gross. The doors were not insulated so the smell form the corridor came into the room, as well as the noise of the lifts stopping at the floor with "ding" each time. The rooms were the tiniest I had ever seen, but that's par for the course with one of these achingly hip hotels. Otherwise the hotel is in a great location in Soho.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location attentive and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Grahamlittlejohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in december , loved the hotel with great views. Lost my wallet first night I was here and staff found it on the sidewalk and made sure I got it back completely intact . Hugely greatfull of the honest and helpful staff . Visited New york for last 8 years around christmas and stayed in soho in several boutique hotels .The Mondrian rates amongst the best. A definite return visit for me next time I am in town

Reviews.Title: “Bit of Miami in a New York setting”
Reviews.Author: ElevenBus
Reviews.Content: The Mondrian Soho is a very pretty small hotel in a great location. The rooms are tiny, but this is not exactly atypical for NYC hotel rooms. The design does make use of the small space, with a scaled down slipper chair, built-in drawers underneath the bed, a sliver of a desk, shower with no tub etc. If you are a light packer and a somewhat agile person this shouldn't be a problem. This design aesthetic is very "Miami" -- pure white and ocean blue everywhere, a bit of glitter here and there. We stayed when it first opened so everything looked pristine, but over time I would imagine it would be difficult to maintain this look. The restaurant looks like a solarium and is just gorgeous. We didn't eat here but the drinks were good. Service was good.

Reviews.Title: “great penthouse views come with disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Jenny F
Reviews.Content: I held a group dinner event at the penthouse and although the views are stunning, the service and food was a disappointment. Planning was difficult due to an inexperienced and overly casual special events coordinator who didn't seem to write anything down. The menu was changed on me the day before the event and even after making a fuss; they still continued to make their own subsitutions without any discussion or explanation! The service was unprofessional and sloppy; most likely due to the young, untrained kids on the wait staff. If you're looking to throw a casual party with stunning views and don't have much concern for details; this is the place. Otherwise, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “cool new hotel”
Reviews.Author: 10179k79
Reviews.Content: The Mondrian Soho has just opened and still feels very new. Cool design throughout the hotel, bright and airy white/blue/marbe color scheme in the rooms with floor-to-ceiling windows. Despite its young age, the hotel has already managed to attract a good crowd to its restaurant/bar/lounge on the ground floor nightly, creating a vibe that is pretty cool and not as drab as most hotel bars. On the flip side, while the decor of the rooms looks good, it is not very practical in many respects. Tiny sinks on top of the mini bar right next to the door with bad lighting serve as the bathroom. Closet is so close to the bed that it is basically inaccessible. Rooms are small even by New York standards. No serious sound proofing, street noise could be heard loudly even on the 22th floor, wide gap under door letting all conversations and service elevator clanking from the hallway into the room, and thin walls. However, overall this is a good place to be, and with the current pricing one of the best choices in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Go_Lucky744
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Mondrian Soho and had an amazing time!! The rooms were clean with a huge bed and equipped with iPad and free wireless which really helped!! The staff were amazingly polite and helpful - best service I have experienced in NYC! Location is great for shopping in Soho and easy access to the subway. We received a great deal via booking.com. Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable!! T&P

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel perfect locarion”
Reviews.Author: phoebewillett
Reviews.Content: after a disasterous couple of nights at the hudson we moved into the mondrian in soho we had a suite with fantastic views a sitting area with tv the bedroom was so comfortable we didnt want to leave the bed just perfect, the restaurant and bar was so beautiful we didnt need to venture far, the locarion was perfect for us as you are right nr tribeca little italy china town the shops everything without the tourists, this will be the only hotel i use in NY from now on end, mini bar had everything from headache tablets to sleeping tablets not that you want to be popping pills but everything was available, we even had our own driver to take us to the airport, just perfect I loved it

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Oasis in SOHO”
Reviews.Author: drdanhaddad
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rustic garden entrance greets guests to this wonderful property hidden from the crowded streets of SOHO on Crosby street. The rooms are wonderfully decorated. We had a marvelous view fro our suite over looking the city's westside with Hudson river in the background. The Resturant Imperial 9 is very cool with great vibe and menue.The service was great not overbearing. Great property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: DJKane2006
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write this review for months. We stayed at the Mondrian end May/early June and loved every minute. The rooms are amazing. We stayed on the 20th floor and had great views. Loved the cool blue/White decor. The whole hotel was spotless and oh so cool. Some people have commented about the 'trendy' clientele but we didn't feel uncomfortable for a second. It was our first time in NYC and we pounded the streets making sure we saw all the sites. We were returning to the hotel rather tired looking but the staff welcomed us & treated us the same way as guests at a champagne reception hosted by Susan Sarandon (yip, that was just one of the snazzy events while we stayed). The bar area is lovely, we enjoyed a good few cocktails there but didn't get around to sampling any of the food. If you're lucky enough to be planning a trip to NY you should definitely consider staying at the Mondrian.

Reviews.Title: “romantic and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: alexnz01
Reviews.Content: love this hotel.from the entrance to the postcard on my pillow, perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Over designed under serviced!”
Reviews.Author: Balaramjohn
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Mondrian was through Tablet private sale for a friday and saturday night, our travel plans then changed and I tried to change the reservation for the next tuesday, wednesday, and after 12 days of emails to tablet I was told that I could not change despite room availability. so changed plans again and arrived at 3:45 pm to find no room available yet, placed in holding pattern in restaurant/bar with many service providers around though none seemed to want to wait on us. told by desk staff person(no name tag, wrinkled look that was expensive I am sure) he would call. I finally called at 4:45 and was informed that the room was ready, Our bags arrived only after another call. Very nice small room with decor by Modern Frigid. Bill under door the day we left charged us 3.81. I called to dispute and she said she would take it off, only to be replaced by a mystery charge of 29.37 on my master card. so the saga continues, I really think that we were not cool enough for the place and I would recommend to anybody considering this hotel to arrive at the 2nd floor check in with their coolest look to start your stay out as the in group.

Reviews.Title: “Great unexpected chosen hotel”
Reviews.Author: xoxotravelmissy
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend unexpectedly end up at this hotel after our original booking of a hotel was overbooked. We are glad we haven't paid the real price f the hotel since it is pricey. The hotel is a the very beginning not very obvious to find unless you take a good look at the map and look at the hotel picture to find how the hotel entrance looks like. The advantage of this hotel, is that it's still new and you'll end up seeing the good side of the hotel for being new. I've read a lot of previous reviews saying how they would hear how loud the neighbors rooms can be. It can be sort of true, but we've barely heard anything from them. Maybe its by luck. There will be at the beginning some issues in the room, like the function of the shower that can be tricky that the technician will help resolve. But you will have the neediness to almost harass the reception, by calling several times with a little of anger, to finally have the person come to the room. I don't quite understand the logic of needing to wait and call several times for the person to come and show up at our room. Especially when you need him not once but twice. I will not blame the technician but the reception that maybe they feel to good to make an effort to dispatch the technician asap. The room can seem small but the way it was designed, makes it see there's no need for more space. I can say I've previously been in a crappier hotel in the past in NYC that was a lot more smaller than this one. So there should be no complaints about the size, since we're in NYC Manhattan, what do you expect? a penthouse size room? The bathroom is a thing to admire since its marbled from top too bottom. One thing that was enjoyable to have in the room was the offered Ipad 2 to be used during the stay. We we're very tempted to bring the ipad 2 out in town but we had the scarcity of loosing it. The only thing that cant be criticize in about the hotel, is the restaurant. From the entrance view, the restaurants looks lovely, but do to the high price of the food we never eat there. So we've always dined out. The trip was great but there's one thing really one thing you will have to know about the place that's essential. The Bell Boys will try to get the run of your money and I'm glad I haven't felt for it. They breath lies when it comes to help you finding a taxi. When you try to take a taxi for the airport or for whatsoever reason... the bell boy in reality will not run around the block to find one. No even after waiting 30 mins for him to find one, he actually stands in front of the second not obvious entrance trying "with so much energy" in finding a cab with a wave of the hand... Yeah he doesn't budge he just stand there hope to get a taxi that already taken. He just never goes out of the hotel piremessis to find one for you. The best part of the whole story is there's a taxi limo at the hotel entrance, that the bell boy will try to convince you to take. The charge of taking that taxi to go at Laguardia airport: 60$. So we finally too initiative too go up the street and get ourselves a taxis after much frustration of the noncooperation from the bell boy. I think he was shocked that we haven't felt for is trap. And we gladly found a taxi after 10 minutes of going up in the streets. Is it luck ?maybe but all i know i saved a lot of money. The better part of all this is when talking to the taxi driver, a real taxi limo will not charge such a high amount of money...So that taxi limo waiting at the hotel is a buddy of the bell boy that will get profit out of you so that bell boy gets a sort of commission out of the scam. That is what really destroyed the end of our trip is the temptation of getting scammed by a guy that as the same age as us. Besides we're two university students that as not a lot of money that went to spend a 3 day shopping trip. Getting ripped off by an idiot like him isn't our thing. Such a heartless, and lazy bell boy. Hope you get fired soon. I regret I haven't filed a complaint about that guy for doing what he did. But i would have never known about the scam without being informed by that nice taxi driver we had. So in the end great hotel for unexpected moment but crappy bell boy when it comes to find a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: GraniteSheep
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and were very impressed with the hotel. The room was a decent size and the iPad in the room was a nice touch, which made planning our visit to NYC so much easier. We didn't eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the food, but we did use the bar. The bar in the conservatory looked lovely but we never got the chance to use it as it was always full, mostly with non-residents. There were tables free, but we were told these were for diners only, which was disappointing. Instead we were ushered into an "overspill" bar off the reception, which although adequate, didn't have the same buzz about it. That was a bit of a let down. Our only other criticism was the concierage service. Although the staff were very helpful and courteous, they didn't have the level of knowledge that we expected. There was a reliance on the internet, which we could have used ourselves on the iPad in the room. However, all the staff from the guys on the door, to reception to housekeeping were very friendly and polite and dealt with any request we had swiftly and to our satisfaction and made our stay very relaxing. Overall we would definitely recommend the Mondrian Soho, depsite the issues above. Although annoying, they didn't detract from our overall stay. The location is excellent, the rooms are great and the ambience of the place is very cool and modern. We really enjoyed it and would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in SoHo”
Reviews.Author: Louis C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed for our first time at the Mondrian SoHo. The hotel welcomes guests with a pretty grass canopy-covered entrance that ushers you away from the street and inside a chic lobby. Vivian at the front desk was very friendly and gave us a complimentary upgrade! Our room was small by most hotel standards, but to be expected as it is Manhattan. Still, we had a large and comfy king size bed, 40-in flat screen tv, and our own iPad with free internet access. Only stayed for 1 night but were very comfortable and would absolutely stay there again. Highlights: VERY friendly and personable staff; great location in heart of SoHo (located on a side street so it's quiet, but just 1/2 block from the busy activity of Broadway); and new, modern decor.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in SOHO”
Reviews.Author: demendieta
Reviews.Content: The Mondrian hotel was an oasis of calm, quality, and service in the middle of soho. The food was seriously the best prepared and presented and of course the best tasting ! The rooms are spotles and ver funkyly decorated and yea the are reall small, I mean closet size small but they are very nice, comfortable and unheard of in New York they were not noisy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: KD_lank
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mondrian for four nights and really enjoyed this hotel. First off the concierge Lumba was a real gem and was absolutely outstanding. The room (although small) was clean, bright and cheery and most of all we loved Soho and the location of the hotel was absolutely ideal for us. The only thing I didn't enjoy was the sink/vanity being a part of the room rather than the bathroom. There were also a few glitches - for example - after one night of room service, it took about 12 hours and multiple calls to have the tray picked up. But these are pretty minor quibbles and did not impacted our trip or the lovely feel and service of the hotel. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barkon
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, in a very nice part of the city. Very clean and very cozy bat mostly very beautifull interior disign. beautifull people to see and polite yÎ¿ung stuff

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location.”
Reviews.Author: The_Firestones
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August of 2011 and have only nice things to say about it. We booked the room last minute on lastminute.com and received a great rate (hid the actual name of the hotel). The room was compact, European's will find the size just perfect, but very well appointed. The view out towards City Hall and the West Side was nice. The place is clean and well maintained. Location is key here and being blocks from Chinatown, Little Italy and shopping on Broadway made this a sweet deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not very bad, but not comming back.....”
Reviews.Author: Cgrasu
Reviews.Content: Positive: Great location, great view, ok service, nice restaurant, well equiped room. Negative: super small room (even though I stayed in a more expensive one), continental breakfast: 21 $ for the worst breakfast choise I have ever seen!!! even for 1 star hotels...; air conditioning wasn't working properly, toilet malfunctioned, and even if it is a design hotel, if you look closer, you see that the materials used are cheep.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cheers526
Reviews.Content: Stayed one nite. Very nice room with a fantastic view. Very clean. Great service. Doorman was very helpful in getting us cabs. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “First time to NYC”
Reviews.Author: jo c
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel. As it was our first time to NYC we found that the hotel is very central and convenient. It is located in close proximity to all train lines and the broadway street mall, spring street, little Italy and China town. Rooms are small but they have been designed well and the room are very comfortable. Heaps of natural light and great views really top this hotel off. I must say the beds are so comfortable and large. The decor of the hotel is much nicer in life than in photos. I would recommend this hotel as its such a fun vibrant hotel. The staff were friendly and willing to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: JitneyW
Reviews.Content: Of all the places I have stayed in NYC this is by far my favorite because of the service, location and amenities. There is a very good restaurant located on the property and it also doubles as a great bar at night. The staff is very attentive and nice... which means a lot, especially for the neighborhood! The beds are extremely comfortable and if you stay with a Morgans Hotel group often they give you a great deal on inexpensive room upgrades (we paid an extra $25 a night). Should also mention that the decor is very neat! Only complaint would be that there were not any full-length mirrors in the rooms. I can't stress enough that the location is GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Good if you like blue and low lighting”
Reviews.Author: ShanghaiPandas
Reviews.Content: Overall a pleasant and functional stay but rooms are quite small and a bit too light... There is a focus on blue throughout the hotel and dim lighting in public areas. I had a corner room on the 18th floor, so rooms had a great view of the NYC Skyline. Was a little hard to get a cab due to the side road location, although staff would always offer to get one for us. Breakfast was good, fast and the service very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and city view”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLoverLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights for a friends wedding. Booked a suite, which was average size for NYC. Great view of the city from the 16th floor (must be even better from higher up). Stayed previously at the Mercer, Soho House, The Crosby, The Bowery, Soho Grand and this compares well - always good to stay in a new/refurbished hotel. Loved the restaurant space and staff generally v friendly. Had some IT issues as a cable was damaged in the street but James, the front desk manager cleared up any issues. Good modern gym in the basement. Very comfortable beds. Denied entry to on-site club as it was "guest list only" which is always a bug bear but maybe could have pre-booked. Location is fine for walking in and around Soho and not too far from Wall Street if you want to see the new memorial. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and design”
Reviews.Author: EonCarr
Reviews.Content: A great staff and nice interior design in a beautiful part of NYC made for a great 5 night stay. The room we had felt quite large for New York although small anywhere else. My wife loved the look of the place and I think it's great place for couples. The restaurant in the greenhouse had a good breakfast and looked quite busy in the evenings. We arrived at 9:00 am from a red-eye flight and were allowed to check-in right away which was great. The hotel also sent a bottle of sparkling wine to our room when they heard about a special event that had occurred which was very kind and thoughtful. Overall, the design and the great staff made this a great stay and we would certainly recommend this hotel. Some small issues: -A noisy air conditioning unit that failed to work on two nights (the staff was very responsive however and a repairman was sent quickly to our room to fix the issue although it returned the second night). -The rooms have hotel ipads that are intended to provide complimentary internet access (wireless is $10/day). The ipad worked only once for a few minutes which was a bit annoying. -The hotel does not have a sign on either entrance and the lobby is on the second floor. Can be a bit confusing if you're not expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, trendy hotel, still needs adjustments.”
Reviews.Author: Sol058
Reviews.Content: The Mondrian Soho is located at the heart of Soho. For a couple, it is a very nice location, in a trendy neighborhood and very close to the subway. Dean & Delucca, Wholefoods and all main fashion brands are right around the corner. We stayed for 4 nights, and booked a room thru booking.com. The hotel had just opened, so we got a very good fare. The rooms are kind of small and the walls are thin, so you can hear other guests walking by your door. Same thing with the bathroom, very little privacy if you are not traveling alone. The decor is nice and modern. Beautiful view from the upper floors. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but had a taste when we ordered room service. It was good, not great. When we first got to our room we noticed that the window didn't close right, so the winter cold kept coming inside. The fridge wasn't working, and neither was the TV. We asked for a new room, which they gave us. However the new room had a tiny bed. We had to complain again, and after a bit of a struggle the following night they gave us a bigger room with a great view. They also invited us to the opening party at the hotel, with a cool band and drinks. We also got to visit the penthouse, which is great. All in all, it has the potential of being a good hotel, it needs to improve the service and some details in the rooms. However, if the rates get higher, I don't know if it's worth it. I think it might be trying too hard to be trendy and forgetting some of the important things like making you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ppaolo73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a couple of days and although I was there for business it seemed to be a holiday. Everything is perfect, white roses and candles create a cosy and romantic atmosphere. There is a magic restuarant in a sort of glass greenhouse with excellent food and service. I'll definetely go back again and recommend it to all my friend as the best place to stay in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Dawn Minto”
Reviews.Author: dawn m
Reviews.Content: If you are like us, and are very busy during our work time, when we are away for pleasure we like something stress free without being invisiable as a person. This hotel is unique in that it is incredibly discreet, elegant, tasteful and offering a sincere service with an attention to detail. This place is perfect for a romantic get away. It's not that easy to find, even though its perfectly located in a great quarter where people live. You won't find a big sign, and when you are looking for the reception you will find it on the second floor, fun thing about that is it feels much more discreet when you are coming in or leaving the hotel. The service offered, and personnel were excellent. These are people who take their profession seriously, whilst still being very friendly and approachable. We strongly recommend this hotel and will look forward to returning. Well done the Morgan Hotel group. Another plus... every room has its own Ipad and the bed was the best ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Classic Neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtraveller2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of SoHo, with a beautiful entrance, and gardens. One thing I noticed upon confirming the reservation, is that if you do not book directly with Morgans, the front desk is much-less likely to prioritize your room requests, such as High floor etc., so try and book direct, unless you get much cheaper elsewhere. I had stayed in a Deluxe Suite, the size of a regular room in most other cities, if not smaller @ 350sqft, but this is New York, but the rooms layout was excellent, and very efficient on space. The hotel opened in 2011 so all the rooms are outfitted with Concierge iPads, want room service, wake up call, flight info, grab the ipad, ordered extra toiletries from it, never showed, but aside from that, a glimpse of the future of hotels to come. The rooms decor is a very comforting, modern yet classy white and Blue color scheme, with floor to ceiling windows that let all the light flow in. The location of Soho is great if going to stay in the lower part of manhattan, but a bit far from Fifth ave, Times square etc. I would reccomend this hotel over most of the other hotels in lower Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad service and management”
Reviews.Author: Fransoavi
Reviews.Content: I've been at Mondrian Soho NYC 3 times in " months. I was the first client at the opening. I loved the design - magical like a poetic movie from Cocteau - and the amazing location. BUT... but, at my Third stayn, I've found bed bugs... they changed me for a suite (great). I eventually needed to stay one more week (two weeks for the third stayn), and no one was calling me back to confirm the extension, despite my relaunches. The day before my last 'official' night, they just ask me to go away 'cause they were full !!! Tribeca film festival, no room in NYC.. and they just telling me top go out ??? After hard negociations, they moved me to another very small - and dirty - room. Sure, better than being on the sidewalk, but are you acting this way for a regular long stayn client ??? Crazy.. Other problems are about service : no ice with soda and always missing stuff in room-service, breakfast serving lasting more than 30 mn, housekeeping failing for 2 days, restaurant full even when you are a guest. Positive : the concierge - Lubna - is the greatest person in this place. She is very concerned by customers and helped me seriously. I'm traveling monthly to NYC, i will NEVER go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: M&M's1
Reviews.Content: Rooms-Good View, European Design, Comfortable Bed. Loved the IPAD in my room. Didn't need to hook up my laptop. Had a King Size bed. 2 Observations- I Could hear the elevator ding every time somebody got off. I was about 3 rooms from the elevator and I could hear people talking in the hallway also. I would give the room a 5 if it wasn't for the sounds I could hear. I thought the junk food selections for the mini bar could be better. Only had a snickers bar for my late night cravings as far as sweets go. Location- I loved the location in Soho. I even saw the US Open Tennis winner staying at our hotel..won't mention names. Overall, I would probably stay here again. The bar and restaurant was nice. Great service at the bar downstairs. I had a drink & a dessert. I was here on business and I would recommend this for business and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Geat all round”
Reviews.Author: BILLYSE21
Reviews.Content: Ideal location just off Broadway in SOHO. Staff were excellent and helpful but not overwhelming. Really nice good sized room for NY and very well appointed bathroom. Couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: barbara l
Reviews.Content: we were a group of 12 persons, teens and adults( between 18 and 45 yo) and we stayed 5 nights. the hotel is very nice, the staff was very helpful,, the location is excellent, and decoration awsome i particularly would like to praise one of the concierg and john the doorman that was fantastic in helping us i would advise this hotel to everybody

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: arabella c
Reviews.Content: Just open few months ago, we had a very glamour stay. Room are not large but this is well balanced by design furniture, cleanliness, amazing view of down Manahattan and a perferct location. Nine Imperial - the restaurant inside the hotel- is excellent and it is one of the coolest place in downtown. Keep in mind that you should like blue...since blue is the dominant colour of the hotel. Staff is kind and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, convenient hotel which will appeal to many”
Reviews.Author: tangek
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Mondrian SoHo for 2 nights, while we were working in NYC. We found an excellent deal on a discount hotel website, and ended up with a small but nice room on the 7th floor of the hotel. Our taxi driver was confused about where the entrance was, as there is no name on the hotel (typical for Ian Shrager hotels). But we found a lovely garden and walked through to see the entrance to the hotel. There is quite a lively bar/restaurant in the lobby, with gorgeous dÃ©cor and even more gorgeous people. (We later stopped down for a drink and found it to be pricey but exciting to watch). The front desk is one floor up from the ground. The staff were friendly and efficient, and were diligent about security procedures (verifying our identity). The elevators were a bit slow to take us to our floor. Our room was white-themed with a slightly whimsical design. We had a very comfortable queen sized bed with a fluffy white comforter, and drawers under the bed. There was an ample closet to both hold our suitcase and hang clothing, as well as having a safe. The room also had a desk area with ipad with lots of interesting selections/controls for the room. The TV was a flat screen with great quality â€“ only issue is that it seemed to be on some sort of timer, where it would switch off at 10:30pm, switch back on at 12:30am and again at 6:30am. Never could figure out how to turn it off! Our room had a window which opened, and a broad view of the street with a peek at some buildings on the skyline. The bathroom had an external sink (outside the bathroom door, with mini bar underneath. The bathroom itself had a toilet and shower/tub combination. We were impressed to see a handheld shower as well as an overhead one, and a deep tub as well. It would have been perfect if only there wasnâ€™t a small leak from the central control area. The toiletries were super interesting, e.g. mint shampoo and rum shower gel. And the towels were wonderful. The neighborhood is typical SoHo, quite industrial on the nearby blocks but quickly changing to shopping to the north and Canal Street to the south. The cab ride to downtown was quick and cheap, definitely a convenient location for Wall Street, etc. We would definitely consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Another fab hotel in the Morgans hotels portfolio”
Reviews.Author: AWalia
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 has just returned from a 5 day stay at this modern deign led hotel which can be described as a hip urban oasis in the heart of the uber-trendy SoHo area in Manhattan. As a former hotel owner/operator it was great to stay in a relaxed and friendly hotel where the fabric of the hotel and the staff come together in harmony. The fabric of the hotel is great as you would expect from this group but the staff make the difference and they were great from the bell boys to the concierge services team, just to mention a few. Nothing seemed too much trouble for them. Concierge services are provided in a relaxed environment and they arranged everything from best Broadway theatre tickets to exclusive sightseeing rides and airline bookings and providing very useful local tips. Check out the Penthouse suites for views to die for. Rooms come with an iPad for guest use for paperless guest service directory and connecting to the electronic world for free - nice touch. The GM (Gary Thomas) is a super guy and he has a great team around him. We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “GREATEST PLACE IN THE UNIVERSE (AND I'VE BEEN TO JUPITER!!!)”
Reviews.Author: GrayBright
Reviews.Content: This is in my opinion the greatest hotel I have ever been to. The hotel was opened in Feb and is gorgeous however, even with new decor and luxury appeal, the staff are what will make your time here the best time ever!!! The location, perfect. The interior, stunning The rooms, delicious The staff, greatest set of people in the world!!!! As soon as you walk in the door you'll be greeted by some of the most awesome people such as Sammy, AJ, Joey, Danny too many to mention all!!! In the lower foyer Jelena will help you out and set the mood with a smile and helpful directions up stairs to check in. You'll then hopefully meet Ben or Katie at the check in depending on what time you arrive, brilliant people. Before you go to your room, you have to meet the jewels of the hotel, Rachel or Lubna or Sasha. They work at the concierge desk, it should be called the "MOST AWESOME PEOPLE EVER" desk (I was going to write it on their desk however it may come across as vandalism...) You wanna go out and have a great night, they'll sort you out. You wanna know where to buy liquor and balloons, they'll sort you out. You wanna do anything, they'll sort you out. Now most places, yeah, I agree, most places will sort you out, but google can tell you were to go as well, it's their personalities that change everything. I spent 3 months in the US, going across 14 states and staying in hotels and this, this was the greatest place I have found. Honestly, it's a gorgeous building, perfect location (safe / friendly / shops all around ect...) but it's the staff, it's the staff that make it brilliant!!!! So serious I am about this review I'll even put my email address so if you ever have questions about it, email me gray@graybright.com and I'll fill you in (I seriously had that much fun there, I was there 9 days in total with 5 friends staying there as well, we all agree, greatest place ever).

Reviews.Title: “Cool”
Reviews.Author: Atul1998
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short nite...has the modern ian schrager look. Very new property at the time of this review - so everything was pristine. Superior room/city view - awesome view of downtown which was rare to see. Not too noisy either. Room had a separate living room area with its own tv and couch, ipad in the room, and bedroom although compact was well laid out with another tv. Downstairs the lounge in the greenhouse was very nice, but a bit noisy with the echo-ing off the glass and service was a bit slow despite it not being too crowded. Definitely a must stay for folks visiting NYC and wanting the downtown vibe - soho/tribeca access...

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and style in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: maze56
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel with its suttle whimsical Beauty and the Beast style. The suite was very spacious though I've heard the regular rooms are a tight squeeze. By far the best feature was the huge window in the shower! Never had a view like that while in the shower before!! Actually the whole room was floor to ceiling windows and simply breathtaking! Another smart feature is the iPads they provide in all the rooms... much appreciated :) The food was good... complimentary breakfast was basic continental but more than adequate and a good start to long days of walking the city. The same room for breakfast is a lounge/bar at night and is beautyfully decorated with stunnig chandeliers and a ceiling of windows... great room with an energetic vibe and many locals coming to hang out at the bar on any given night. The service was stellar and the location perfect I'd go back without hesitation :) Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel. Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Orly5678
Reviews.Content: Keeping to our theme of NYC weekends for birthday get aways, we decided to experience another Morgan Group Hotel. We had the best time in Miami at the Delano and looked forward to our stay in NYC. The service was great. The concierge was helpful in providing things in the area to do as well as restaurant reservation. Their recommendation for The Darby was a perfect fit for what we were looking for. If I were to provide any feedback in this regard I'd simply ask to be informed of any unique charges a restaurant would charge. The Darby provided live music which was FANTASTIC, but I was a bit surprised with the $50 "Entertainment" charge. The room was trendy and neat, equipped with an I pad, Ipod doc, great use of space. The walls were a bit thin so we heard the elevator as well as the pepople walking through the halls. But overall we had a great stay. The hotel in general was very fashionably decorated, so much so that I took pictures to add some style to my own home. The location of the Mondrian was ideal. We walked for hours and just loved the surrounding area. I'd recommend a stay at the Mondrian, along with any Morgans Group Hotel. I am looking forward to trying the next hotel from the group.

Reviews.Title: “Our beautiful secret in the heart of Soho!”
Reviews.Author: teachmetonite
Reviews.Content: This was such a beautiful hotel - chic design, private, and outstanding service. The rooms were pretty small, but it is in the heart of Manhattan! A great value through Priceline and we felt so pampered by the staff that we want to come back every year! Walking distance to amazing shopping and restaurants in Soho - close to Chinatown, too. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother - much nicer accommodations up the street”
Reviews.Author: MajesticUsa
Reviews.Content: I thought I would try the Mondrian as I am a fan of Morgans. Big disappointment. Location is not good and staff is below average, with attitude. Room was not functional and wear and tear is visible. Restaurant food was awful. The only nice thing is the decor. Service was painfully slow. If you're looking for a Soho hotel, go to Crosby up the Street. They get it. Or go to the Mercer - an old timer that beats Mondrian hands down. Morgans is off my list. There is so much better out there these days.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL, BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: hihi_11
Reviews.Content: What can I say, the Mondrian Soho is absolutely gorgeous. I stayed here for my wedding and it was a fairytale hotel, just fantastic. The problem is the staff at this hotel, they are rude and very unhelpful. Twice I called the concierge to schedule a limo for my wedding and both times they never got back to me. I had to book my own limo for my wedding, which was fine but irritating for such a fancy hotel. My reservations were under my first name and not my last so they couldn't find it and I was panicked as the front desk people tried to not look worried. When we asked what came with the room the desk person said a mini bar. We were never told about the safe, restaurants, internet or laundry service. My husband could not get over how unprofessional the front desk staff was. There was a bottle of wine in our room with a note for a different person---attention to detail, not so good. We had asked the person who booked my room many times about photos on our wedding day and I was assured it would not be a problem. 5 minutes into photos I was told the manager was upset and wanted to know who gave us permission for photos. I WAS LIVID. We were running late anyway for our wedding and then had to deal with this after I asked so many times if it would be okay. It started my wedding day off really bad. We asked the restaurant attendant how we went about getting some food and she snapped at us and said to ask the front desk she didn't know how it worked, we has to sign up in advance. She was so awful. For such an expensive hotel, you have to pay for internet! They do have ipads in the room that you can get on for free but it was set up to be quite a bother. We were also told that we would be able to use a steamer for our wedding clothes when we booked the room only to find out we couldn't and if we did we would have a huge charge. After talking with the manager we miraculously had a steamer in our room after being told by the front desk person that they weren't portable. On the up side, the room itself was INCREDIBLE, clean and like nothing I have ever seen, blue carpet and crisp white walls. Floor to ceiling windows with views of the city, perfect lighting for the make up artist and photos, an amazing bathroom and just over all outstanding and dreamy. I would stay here again just because it is that beautiful and it was perfect for a wedding. Hope the staff can try to smile and be a bit more friendly next time. They also let us stay an extra hour after check out time which I thought was very, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Detts11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing it has the nest location of any in SOHO. The staff is very helpful but definitely a little hipster which we enjoyed! If you are wondering where to stay, this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Imazoid
Reviews.Content: When I booked this I must admit I was a little concerned about some of the reviews, however it seems the more critical ones were written just after the hotel opened, and these issues have been resolved, I cannot fault my stay here at all. The location is great. Very close to the Subway (Canal Street N,Q,R is the closest stop) and just a short walk to Little Italy and Chinatown. Finding the hotel initially can be a little challenging as there is no sign displayed, but as soon as you see a courtyard with a walkway with climbing vines, you've got there. Reception is not actually on the ground floor, you need to take an elevator up one level but don't be concerned about getting lost, the friendly doormen will make sure you head in the right direction. Checking in was very efficient. OK, the rooms. Like most hotel rooms in New York they are not large, but they are equipped with everything you need except a coffee maker, which I didn't find too burdensome as I've never been impressed by the stuff that hotels supply in the room anyway. Our bed was a king sized bed and very comfortable. I loved the fact that the bed had additional storage built into the base as well as a decent sized closet and a chest of draws. Every room has an iPad in it which largely takes the place of the big books that you find in most hotels. You can access the Internet for free via this iPad, accessing it through any other device can bring you a charge of approx $10 a day. The Internet service was reliable during our stay. You can also access the websites of some of the major papers via the iPad, I noticed the New York Times, Wall Street Journal, USA Today, and the British Guardian Newspaper for example. The bathroom is small, just enough room for a shower and a WC. Water pressure and temperature was great. If bathroom privacy is a major concern for you, be aware that there is frosted glass panelling separating the bathroom from the rest of the room, no you can't see what is going on in there but it's not the best sound barrier. The sink is actually in the room entrance foyer and separate from the rest of the bathroom The room also contains a Mini bar (which thankfully is not of the type fitted with sensors that charge you the moment you pick something up). It keeps things cool but not cold, for that you'll have to call for ice. A phone call to the front desk will quickly get you a large bucket of ice, the floors themselves do not have ice making machines and there is no ice bucket in the room. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and always seemed to be smiling, looks like they enjoy their work. Some earlier reviews did comment about the noise. I am a light sleeper but found this hotel no nosier than any others I have stayed in. In fact the hotel was fully booked but there was no noise from adjoining guest rooms. In the evenings, the ground floor restaurant and bar do appear to become quite a social attraction, coming back in shorts and a tee shirt did make me feel a little underdressed when compared to the patrons of the bar, but that didn't matter to the hotel staff who were always welcoming. If you do need food or drinks without using the hotel facilities, there is a 24 hour grocery store on Broadway and plenty of other places which are not 24 hour but may better meet your needs. Overall I was extremely satisfied with my stay, friendly staff, the rooms were kept clean, and a great location from which to explore New York City. If I find myself staying here again, I would not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous but small”
Reviews.Author: IslandHopper888
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the new Mondrian Soho on Crosby st in downtown New York recently and had a great time. The room was small but well decorated and comfortable. Staff were pleasant and attentive and overall a great experience. Location is very helpful if you are working downtown, if not the subways are close at hand. Overall a fine property and one I can recommend to anyone traveling there

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marmee14
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was amazing! The decor, right from the trellised entryway, to the dining areas and bar, were beautiful and magical. Service was very friendly, helpful and totally unpretentious. The location was excellent, close to good shopping and eating experience. The room was so comfortable, and the view so amazing from our room,that it wasn't easy to leave it every day! Next time we're in New York, this will be our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clancym123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a weeks holiday and were very impressed with the hotel. We had read some mixed reviews on tripadvisor but put much of that down to issues with the hotel just being newly opened. This was our first trip to NYC and we just loved the location of the hotel. The staff were spot on with their recommendations for local places to eat and were always very welcoming and helpful. We never actually ate at the hotel or used the bar but both did look beautifully kitted out, as did the foyer areas. The rooms, although small, were well thought out in terms of their design and had a surprising amount of storage and the finishing and detailing was luxe. The mini bar was reasonably priced and had a thoughtful and cute selection of items for sale.
