The only negative feedback I would provide was a) the air con was difficult to manage and the console was quite high on the wall b) the shower had a tendency to flood the entire bathroom no matter how you directed the nozzel c) the safe was too high in the wardrobe and difficult to access We did however love the huge bed, crisp linens, in room iPad, orchids, toiletry selection and the amazing location. We would heartily recommend the Mondrian Soho to any leisure travellers. We had a wonderful holiday and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, will be back.”
Reviews.Author: taliaa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mondrian Soho for three nights in August 2011. We hadnâ€™t stayed at a boutique hotel in ages and we were pleasantly surprised. As others have noted, our cab driver couldn't figure out how to get to â€˜9 Crosbyâ€™, so instead of battling traffic again, we just walked half a block to the hotel. There is no sign outside but we recognized the greenery and canopy from the photos we saw here on Trip Advisor. We paid $30 including tip for our cab ride from La Guardia at around 12pm. The staff at the door were quite young - a trend we saw throughout the hotel. There weren't any 'grown-ups' over the age of 35 that we could see. The language and manner in which we were spoken to was professional but definitely California cool, very informal. "Hey, Brother, let me help you with that." "Hey man, my name is <insert name>, let me know if you have any questions." Perhaps itâ€™s because we were the same age and perhaps some of the older people in the hotel were not spoken to like that. Since we arrived too early for check-in, we left our bags with the boys. We went to check-in, which is located on the second floor and was relatively quick. We needed to send some work emails and they didnâ€™t hesitate to give us the WIFI code. As a result, we didnâ€™t need to pay for internet during our stay. Perhaps that was an oops on their end, but we were happy about that. Upon entering the hotel, there is a nice fragrance, the dÃ©cor is all blue and white and the restaurant and bar are beautifully decorated with glass and other beautiful textures and materials. It must be beautiful in the winter as well. There is a beautiful balcony opposite the check-in to just sit out and relax â€“ granted, its astroturf, but itâ€™s a beautiful contrast to the hotelâ€™s dÃ©cor and quite welcoming. When we returned to get our room after 3pm, we were upgraded to a King room from a Queen room on a high floor; the view was great. The elevator ride was surprisingly dark with a dim blue light and played loud music. We had trouble with our key, but still managed to get in the room. This problem was never resolved although we didnâ€™t mention it until late on our second day. Apparently all the vacuuming of the halls sends fibers into the air which block the key readers in the doors. The rooms are on the smaller side, but its standard for NYC as others have mentioned. The floor-to-ceiling windows were beautiful as was the dÃ©cor. The royal blue carpets were clean, but show every spec of dirt and dust. The layout was well thought out with storage in the base of the bed and a fairly large chest of drawers. Showers were decent; my husband didnâ€™t think there was enough pressure, but I found no issues with it at all and I like a very strong shower. The toiletries were very nice from Malin and Goetz. They were replenished each day even though the original bottles were not completely finished. The relatively small sink is outside the shower/toilet room â€“ wish they had a towel rack to hang hand towels/face cloths; nowhere to put them to dry properly. Safe was in the closet, but was high up on the shelf in the closet so for someone of my height (5â€™3â€�), it was hard to see what we put in there. Beds were beautiful to look at â€“ very comfy when lying down, but both my husband and I had trouble sleeping all three nights. The beds were a bit too soft for our liking and the pillows were feather. We changed them to foam, but still didnâ€™t sleep as well as weâ€™d hoped. There is no turn-down service in the hotel although there is room service which we never used. Overall, the room was very clean and Iâ€™m a complete germaphobe. Although I wanted to break out the Lysol, I fought the urge. Breakfast was included with our rate each morning. We were pleasantly surprised by the Continental breakfast â€“ not as bad as others have felt it was. Fresh fruit, nuts, cheeses, cold-cuts, muffins and the some of the most delicious croissant Iâ€™ve ever had â€“ reminiscent of visits to Paris. For $21, it would have been steep since weâ€™re not crazy-about-breakfast people, but definitely better than other hotels Iâ€™ve seen. The last day I should mention someone in the kitchen seriously screwed up â€“ they ran out of croissant at 9:05am. Come on. I know the number of guests dropped significantly on the last day, but come on. Youâ€™ve gotta have some bread for guests. I wasnâ€™t impressed with that oversight. Granted, they were apologetic and offered plain toast, but seems to me that kind of problem is resolved by calling a local bakery and getting more croissants STAT. There were line-ups of guests after we left breakfast â€“ Iâ€™m certain people were not pleased. They called our cab back to La Guardia relatively quickly from the Lafayette St. entrance and were very polite as they bid us adieu. Overall, our stay was quite uneventful and enjoyable. We liked the proximity to Canal St. and the Yellow subway lineâ€¦we got everywhere we need to go with that (including a mistake trip to Brooklyn on an Express train!), but we loved the area. After staying in the Upper East Side most of our visits to NYC, this was refreshing. Yes, it is on the lower east part of Soho, perhaps not really IN Soho but we didnâ€™t feel like we were not part of the excitement or too far into Chinatown. We would definitely stay here again and will likely recommend it to our friends. Be sure to check out consolidators such as Hotwire for great deals. We got a fantastic rate including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome !!”
Reviews.Author: bajagirl2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, the staff is amazing! This is a well run hotel! The rooms are newly remodeled and beautifully decorated ( we didnt even notice how small it was), the linens were very nice - the bed was soooo comfortable. Our room was floor to ceiling windows with a view of three bridges and the new york skyline. The hotel provides an Ipad in each room with free internet, ( although the internet was not as high speed as I would have liked and they put their own interface to help guests, but it made using the internet a bit tedious ) a small desk, and mini bar. Concierge services were excellent. They held our bags before check in as well as after as we still had several hours to see more of the city before our flight out . They even offered 1:00 pm check out at no charge, which I have heard other hotels charge for. They also have a few decks off of the lobby ( 2nd floor) for outdoor seating, with umbrellas, chairs and coffee tables.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, femme boutique hotel with friendly service in SoHo (food meh)”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelerGuy
Reviews.Content: Our Standard room was practically European small, but functional. Decorated in a very French feeling white wood with bright blue trim, with a modern albeit tiny bathroom. Cute, very Ian Schraeger-like. I have heard that their suites are very impressive. The standard room, though, actually was OK for us for 4 days despite its tiny size. Nice large screen TV. Free Wi-Fi which is good because I personally hate to pay for Wi-Fi - also good because their bandwidth is very limited. I have heard the restaurant food is good, but frankly the room service is NOT GOOD. Not terrible, just ... wrong items, poorly cooked, and a VERY small menu for room service. Also NYC expensive. You have to call down for ice, which means you have to tip every time you want ice ... lolwut? Windows open slightly for semi-fresh NYC air - but I like opening windows. Slightly noisy air conditioner but it worked GREAT, and NYC was HOT when we visited. One free bottle of water per day. Leaving a tip on the bed does not result in more goodies or extras like chocolate on the bed or more bathroom sundries. Nor a thank you from maid staff. Cute feminine inspired boutique hotel with extremely friendly staff. Would not recommend room service, ever. Very close to Chinatown! Very close to Little Italy. In lower SoHo which has terrible traffic but LOTS of "action" (people on the streets). Chinese food and Italian food surprisingly meh/average. Very surprising. Noah's Ark deli near Lower East Side (but in a nice area) is EXCELLENT NY Jewish deli. Seriously. Central Park in summertime is freakin' amazingly beautiful. NYC people were ALL - every. single. one. FRIENDLY. Someone has talked to the ENTIRE city of New York and they have evolved to be FRIENDLY to tourists. I would go back to NYC in a minute, and I would stay at the Mondrian SoHo for location, friendliness, and cuteness/cleanliness. Rates via American Airlines were $144 a night for a standard room, which is cheap. However, they don't tell you very clearly that a Standard Room means SMALL. My bad. Now I know.

Reviews.Title: “Great stylish hotel in SOHO New York”
Reviews.Author: alberto_bruni_photo
Reviews.Content: Mondrian SOHO is a really great stylish hotel in SoHo, New York. If you arrive you donÂ´t recognize at first that this is an hotel. A great Wintergarden as bar and restaurant in front of the hotel offers a great place to stay. The lobby is very stylish and I love the design of the hotel. The rooms are in white and blue colours. Windows from the roof to the top of the room offers a great view on New York City. Therefore I suggest to book a room in the upper level. The stuff is reall friendly and helpfull. The location is great even for shooping, restaurants and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Customer Services”
Reviews.Author: newman8or
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mondrian Soho in February on a business trip. The decor is very trendy and food is good, but I did feel that staying there for a week became a little too much as the hotel seemed to concentrate on private parties so getting any sort of respite from a long day at work was difficult as you found yourself surrounded by people not staying in the hotel who were obviosuly there to party. You want a quiet meal in the evening. Forget it. If you were going to NY for the weekend its fine but not for a business trip. Why have I rated this hotel so poorly I hear you ask? I have emailed the management there on 6 seperate occasions and not had one response back, not even a thanks for your email/query and we will get back to you - how terrible is that?! One was even adressed the 'The Hotel Manager'. I may sound pedantic but a simple response from the management is not too much to ask. Poor. Very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Soho hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: neige8
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on booking.com so despite the critical reviews we decided to give it a try. PROS: Staff is really friendly and helpful. Super comfortable bed & pillows. Great soho location- shopping & close to the subway. Cool entrance, lobby and restaurant Nice Complimentary breakfast Hip blue and white themed rooms. Nice smelling bath products. IPads in all the rooms. Con. No free wifi and you pay per day & per device ( how hard is it to make this free) Taxis have no idea where this hotel is- make sure you have the address. Shower head aimed right at door- could not adjust it so it got water all over the bathroom floor. Small rooms- but where arranged to maximize the space. Overall we had a great stay and loved the trendy design and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: andrykowski
Reviews.Content: Great location with incredible views of the Hudson River, Empire State Building and the Brooklyn Bridge. Very close to shops and subways.I stayed at the hotel for a number of weeks and the service made me feel as if I were the only one there. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little jewel downtown”
Reviews.Author: magsweeney
Reviews.Content: This is a really comfortable, funky and modern oasis in the midst of downtown Manhattan. Its beautiful entrance draws you in to a very smart, chic and friendly hotel that feels just a little bit different to other hotels. Bedrooms are really lovely and fresh and the hotel atmosphere is really classy and welcoming. Staff are very friendly, helpful and engage very professionally. This is a real little gem of a hotel , one which I'd recommend without reservation. We'll be back

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LunaLaila
Reviews.Content: I was there for a business meeting with a group of 12. The hotel room was a little small but very clean. There was an Ipad, but you can't use it fully. It's just for alarm and some hotel things. The metting rooms were good and food pretty good. The walls between rooms were very thin and I could hear what was going on next door. The area is good and short walking distance from stores and restaurants. There was a restaurant close by, La esquina, it was great. Make reservations for the regular underground dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish, great location, not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: SSGurgaon
Reviews.Content: We were booked here by our NY based friends on our USA tour last month and I was kind of skeptical about this hotel as was travelling with a child (8 yr old) and this hotel didnt seem at all family types. Well it surely is very hip, great location, had swarms of trendily dressed people in the evenings and while we did not exactly fit their desired clientele (read below 30s, nattily-dressed, party-animal sorts), the staff was always very nice and helpful. I found the room awfully small, we had a Double Twin bed room and there was barely any room around the beds, the bathroom was also tiny. I found the decor also wierd, stark white with some slashes of blue. But the beds were super-comfy with loads of pillows. They also need to light up the elevators a little bit more which are kept awfully dark for some reason (style again ??). And they really need to put a signage for the hotel outside, our cab went twice the street up and down before we found it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and personal!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hattur631
Reviews.Content: First time I write here but feel I need to because I use this site a lot and read some bad comments about the service before I arrived. If that was the case, that has definetelly been fixed. To give you couple of examples, I just got filled on my mini bar with cold beer at lunch. The one filling my mini bar did go specially to an empty room to get cold beers without me asking. The conciere fixes impossible theatre tickets to Book of Mormon (they have sold the productions seats until September) and the personal service of knowing who you are and where you come from from the first day and still very laid back. Have to mention that the double egg breakfast is to die for! You call for something and it is there in a minute. To name some, I have stayed at Tribecca Grand, Soho Grand, couple of W hotels, Hudson and several others in that genre here in NYC and I can say that Mondrian tops them all! It is a new Morgan hotel so no need to write anything about the facilities, they are top notch. Why am I writing this? Guess I just wants people like me to experience a great hotel in this wonderful town. The hotel is the foundation of a good trip and mine has definetelly been that and I have a few days left that I am looking forward to :-) Kris

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: azanboutiquefan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mondrian last week for one night, and let me tell you that i had an amazing experience. I live in new- york and we rented the room for a litle getaway with my wife. From the amazing decor, the beautiful and great staff we had an experience to remember. We definitly coming back as soon as we can .. I would recommend this hotel to anybody that wants to have different hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool movie-like hotel, amazing beds”
Reviews.Author: rabbunn
Reviews.Content: I stayed a night with my boyfriend and the staff was very nice and accommodating. The bed was awesome, we felt like we were sleeping on clouds. Only bad thing was that housekeeping woke us up at 10. Yes, we know check out is at noon, but if we came back late and can squeeze in one more hour of sleep before a long trip back (and considering that the price is not a bargain), then please let us wake up to the alarm - we'll still check out at 12 and you can clean the room then.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kanta79
Reviews.Content: Having read the review below, (dated 12/6) I throughly disagree with the review. I think the hotel got it extremley right when they picked the group of people that it wanted to attract. I Travel to NYC 4/5 times a year, this has got to be the best place I have stayed in by far, location, room and stay was excellent. Only fault I would say that there should be a sign as you enter to direct you to the next floor as its unclear where the reception is. Also the continental breakfast is very disappointing - I wouldnt bother to include this as a part of the deal. There are plenty of cheaper places to have breakfast a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “A force to be reckoned with!”
Reviews.Author: sdchalmers
Reviews.Content: From start to finish our stay was for lack of a better word, incredible. The design, location and especially the staff made our stay faultless. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “The epitome of pretenciousness”
Reviews.Author: fry_xx
Reviews.Content: The location is good, this is undeniable. But the hotel pretends being trendy, hip, cool, classy and... it is none of those things. It is just pretentious (decoration, service, restaurant) and makes you feel totally unwelcome in the hotel, especially in the common areas, if you do not fit the type of client they are trying to attract. For a hotel of this prize, they should make you feel like you're the king of NY; in my case, I felt as though I was in the wrong place at all times. The hotel needs to make up their mind on whether they want 'normal' clients (if you are really a normal person you will know what I mean) or they just want the type of people who dress up like italian pimps at all times of the day. I've been in five-star hotels more expensive than this one and never felt unwelcome or out of place, so it is not a question of prize or stars, it is a deliberate choice of the management. If you don't think I am good enough for your hotel, please let me know before taking my money. The only good thing I can say about it is that the bed was comfortable and... yep, that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Can NOT fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: fromlondon66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, we had a lovely room with an amazing view. Checked in with ease and were greeted with such a warm welcome. The room was perfect and having the I Pad in the room is a great bonus. le. The staff could not be more helpful here. I was staying for pleasure but would use this hotel for any future business trips too, as they pull out all the stops to make sure your stay is not only comfortable but memorable. A special thank you to concierge for checking me in on my flight back to london and printing my boarding pass for me and to the bell boys who stood outside in rush hour to ensure I got a cab on time to the airport. All in all the rooms are a good size, stylish and very comfertable, for the value for money this hotel excels. However it is the friendly staff that make this hotel so great.

Reviews.Title: “Doing NYC right!”
Reviews.Author: SashaYayo
Reviews.Content: spend some time in the lounge and do yourself a favor, order a mojito, Number Eight and Number Nine from the cocktail menu. You will not be disappointed. A big thank you to the staff who made our newly engaged stay absolutely perfect! We'll definitely be staying here next time we're in NYC! What up Mondrian SOHO!

Reviews.Title: “Modern New York Style at it'd Best”
Reviews.Author: MikeLondonNW
Reviews.Content: I was in New York with my sister for my nephews graduation and decided to stay at Mondrian Soho for it reputation, and location. We were not dissapointed, in fact the hotel exceeded our expectations in every way. The staff were so friendly, concierge's, Lubna and Rachel, gave us great origonal suggestions, always with a cheerful smile.The recepton team, including Kate and Sasha, were a delight. Cannot wait to return ad make more use of the fabulous bar!

Reviews.Title: “bottom line---I WILL BE BACK!”
Reviews.Author: WindycityGAL82
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Mondrian with some friends and absolutely LOVED it! It is in the heart of Soho and the views from the hotel are amazing. I felt relaxed as soon as I entered the hotel because of its cleanliness and the beautiful blue and white color scheme! The people at the reception desk were extremely friendly and very helpful in answering any questions that we had so I would say that the staff and service are the best that I've come across in the City. The bar decor is chic and fabulous and the food at Imperial is impeccable! I will definitely look no further when booking a hotel in New York City...The Mondrian Soho is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Funky/cool SOHO hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MikeDVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Mondrian SOHO over the past four days. The hotel is beautiful, the location is great for SOHO shopping, the food in the restaurant is creative and amazing, and the staff has clearly been hired for their positive attitudes and love of customer service. Quick note: the restaurant/bar is rockin' well past 2am so make sure your room is at least on the 5th floor or not on Crosby Street or you'll hear the subwoofer pounding. We're definitely staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “mondrian soho is a winner!”
Reviews.Author: spiritedtraveller51
Reviews.Content: The Mondrian Soho is ideally located,in the heart of Soho,but on a side street with much less noise.Entryway and lobby inviting with a cool,chic sparse decor.Check-in upstairs,from entering to check-in,entire process seamless.The rooms exude style and while a tad tight,are efficiently laid out,including I Pads in each room.Bathrooms had a good strong shower and lots of room for toiletries,a plus in my books.The bar and breakfast area downstairs were casually inviting with a good variety of nibbles and drinks.Concierge was top notch and very helpful.Would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Classy new hotel from Morgan's group in Soho, worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: barbaraGeneva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the latest from the Morgan group, my favorite hotel group worldwide. When they offered a special deal in advance of the opening, I booked it for a New York business trip. The neighborhood is great, once you find the hotel--close to the corner of Howard and Crosby, or one block north of Lafayette and Canal Street. We were upgraded to a king suite--the two rooms together were the size of a spacious uptown double room (Sofitel, eg). The spectacular view across the rooftops from the floor to ceiling windows made time spent in the room incredibly agreeable. The bathroom configuration was interesting--all marble, a big shower and toilet in one room with a large frosted window, and the tiny sink on top of the fridge/minibar next to the entry. The color scheme is blue on white, soothing. The hotel is home to the most beautiful atrium bar I have ever seen in New York, drinks are very good but pricey at $20 for a martini. Downstairs reception-men are really helpful for info and cabs and whatever; reception is one flight up and personnel are helpful. The hotel opened just two months ago so housekeeping--impeccable at all Morgan hotels--is still fine-tuning.

Reviews.Title: “Beware 'the glitch'! Serious safety issue!”
Reviews.Author: mailtruck
Reviews.Content: My wife arrived one night ahead of me for a three night stay. At 4am, she was awakened by someone who had just checked in and been given a key to our room! Luckily she had the safety latch locked. She called the front desk and they said it was a 'glitch.' They were totally unapologetic and unconcerned. That is a total lack of understanding of the importance of safety and security in a hotel, not to mention a terrible way to treat a customer who had just been frightened and was staying in her room alone. The next morning my wife tracked down the manager, who was more responsive and did comp us a free dinner after some negotiations. The manager said she had heard about the incident from the staff. I would have preferred if she had approached us about it if she knew that it had happened. There was not a good explanation of how this serious safety issue could have happened or whether they knew how to prevent it from happening again. Of lesser concern, but also problematic, is the room entrance design, which places your neighbor's door directly facing yours about three feet away in a very small hallway. This creates huge noise issues as your neighbor enters and exits their room (in our case every night very late). Noise is a big problem here as the walls are also poorly insulated. It is a great location, and our waiter at Imperial No. 9 was fantastic, but I can't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: jwoodlee
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in the Meatpacking District near my office but I wanted to try the new Mondrian Soho as they have fun properties elsewhere. I called to make my reservation as their booking system wasn't working and I was arriving on a redeye and wanted to have a room ready that morning. They didn't note that properly and cancelled my entire reservation when I didn't check in the prior night. Reservations couldn't help, the front desk couldn't help get me into a room so I could shower and change for my meetings. They were inflexible and generally unhelpful, especially considering it was their fault. Not even close to the level of service expected from such a luxury hotel. I will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: F_Brz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in april, business trip. The rooms are clean, comfortable and silent. We got a room on the 21st floor - you can have a shower with a beautiful view of NY from the large window in the bathroom. There was an iPad in the room, providing information and concierge services. Service was great, from the doorman to the concierge. I needed help with some packages sent in the name of another person by mistake and the staff found them in just a few minutes. The doorman was extremely helpful, running almost a block to hail a cab for us when we left. I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A New Hotel that is a dump and cheaply built.”
Reviews.Author: RichardQ61
Reviews.Content: This opened in February and the rooms are terrible. Very small desk, very small sink counter. You can tell the rooms were cheaply put together with cheap wood trim and cheap closet door. Desk is very small, almost not big enough for my small computer. You have order ice from room service, which took 30-40 minutes everytime and one time they did not send it at all. The hostess at the "gate" to the dining room or bar, ignores you until she is ready to talk to you. You get the inpression you are not good enough to be in her space. They have tried to cram everything into a small space and it shows. I have stayed at the W , Times Square many times and it can be on the small side but there is far more space and a far nicer hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the bell service was very good. On Sat night at 7:00 PM I wanted some restaurant recomends and the concierge was not even there. The hotel is located in nowhere land. It is at the far end of SOHO where there is nothing happening or close restaurants. You have to walk several blocks to shopping or have dinner. Had I arrived on Wed night instead of Thursday, I would have definitely checked out and moved to another hotel. For the very large dollars I paid , I really feel it is a way overpriced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Cool NY Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louisesy
Reviews.Content: Booked a 4 night stay with my friend with an introductory rate..(soft opening) We were not sure what to expect but we were so impressed with the location, the staff, and the comfy clean room. The room was small but very well equipped with ipad. The staff were always pleasant and very professional and went out of their way to be helpful, especially, Jonathan on the door, Ian head of front desk and the lovely concierge lady, sorry we cant remember her name . This is a funky cool new hotel and even though we are nearly fifty we did not feel out of place. We enjoyed meeting fun people from all walks of life. From reading previous reviews with many complaints we feel that there are bound to be glitches in a new hotel and we had our share (ie:phone not working) but these were rectified immediately. It has been a long time since we have stayed in such a fun hotel with great people...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay overall”
Reviews.Author: Pinky Pig
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during the opening period with my husband and 10 month old baby. We had a lovely room on around 15 Floor. I was worried about noise but didn't hear any (just our own adorable screaming baby in the middle of the night!) On arrival we tried to check in but had to wait several hours - think it was about 6pm when we finally got our room. They gave us a round of free drinks and a small upgrade so we were fairly happy with that. The rooms are lovely and ours had a great view. We had one with a broken towel rail - it got fixed almost immediately. Our ipad didn't work - tech support fixed it asap. Water pressure in the main shower head was useless but the secondary middle shower head was fine and we managed that way. We loved the door staff. One night we had torrential rain and the guy was out in it for 15 minutes tracking down a cab for us in the rain (thanks guys!) One tip if travelling with a baby: there is no kettle or teamaking facility in the room so heating anything ie bottles or food is almost impossible without a bottle warmer (which I didn't have!) The kitchen were happy to give me a jug of boiled water which I took to the room. Concierge arranged us a good car service with baby seat for transfer to JFK. All in all we really liked it. A fun, relaxed hotel with a 'cool young' vibe that was ok even for us late 30-somethings!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF......LOCATION PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: hayd1405
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to stay in a Suite at this new hotel in Soho and wow what views of Broadway I had. The room was super comfy, bed was everything a bed away from home should be. The restaurant downstairs Imperial 9 was perfect for a drink or meal, great ambiance and super cool. The guys who ran the doors were so helpful to out of towner's with directions and subway info, made life very easy. I'm heading back in June and I wont be trying a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Put the hotel to the test”
Reviews.Author: tmonk1968
Reviews.Content: After reading the Tripadivsor reviews I expected the worst from the Mondrian. I expected the business cards I sent, via FedEx, to be lost (but they weren't. Instead, I picked them up from the front desk right on time). I expected the staff to be inattentive (but they were very quick to meet my needs). I expected it to be difficult to hail a cab (but it wasn't - in fact, the doorman actually ran a block and a half up the street to hail a cab). I expected poor service from the concierge (but it was absolutely stellar - in fact, Rachel, the concierge at the time, recommended a fantastic little neighborhood gem of a burger joint just perfect for a quiet, cozy dinner.). I expected room service to be slow (but it was perfectly timed). I really can't think of any other tests to put the Mondrian through. It looks like they've incorporated their learnings from previous responses and are well on their way of becoming a fantastic hotel. Will I be back? Yep - absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TomCT714
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mondrian Soho for two nights, which was a combination of a business meeting and some time for relaxation. The hotel is very trendy and beautiful. As other reviews have stated, there is no visible sign outside and no directions to reception when you first walk in...but it's not that hard if you know the address and/or have seen pictures! I'm not a cab person...I prefer the subway, and the NQR/6 is right around the corner. Also steps to Chinatown and Little Italy and nice shopping, either boutique or Bloomingdales. The bed in my room was extremely comfortable and I can say that I had two of the best nights of sleep. The walls are extremely thin. I did not mind any of the noise from the lobby...not did I hear much of it once I reached my room. The music in the lobby and the halls fit the hotel very well. I would not expect rooms to be completely soundproof, but I was upset at being able to hear even the smallest noises (people zipping up their clothes next door when getting dressed in the morning) or conversations of the housekeeping members in the hallway and on their walkies. I did not complain, as I would not expect the hotel to ask someone to zipper quietly or re-insulate the walls during my stay, but sound between rooms and the hallway is something they should consider for the future. Housekeeping is done until 10pm at night. On my first day out, I came back from a meeting at 4pm and my room had not yet been made up. I wanted to take a nap before going out for the evening, and even though I put out a privacy sign, I got a call from housekeeping (after hearing a walkie talkie outside my door) asking when they could make up the room. I did see that on the iPad in the room, there is a section to request housekeeping, so it may be beneficial to use that when you first go out for the day so that you come back to a made-up room. By biggest problem was at check-in. As a little background info, I am one of the people who no longer carries a credit card. I have a debit card that can be swiped as a credit card. I usually keep my funds in savings, and transfer over small amounts to my card account to use when needed. So upon check-in, my hotel room was paid. I was asked to see a credit card, which would not be charged, but used to put a hold for incidentals. I was told that the card was declined and asked for another charge. When I asked the hold about, I was told that $300 was held for incidentals. I understand that copying a card or holding a small amount is common, but I found $300 to be very large. I didn't want to explain my full financial arrangements to the lady at check-in, but I told her that I would need to transfer some money over. I could not get internet service on my phone, and she told me that people tend to get service near the terrace. I still could not, so walked downstair and outside to call my bank, and by that time was unable to complete the transaction. I had enough to pay for the hotel, have a little cash for the night, and planned to do my transferring in the morning. I asked her (Kate, I believe), if there was any way I they could amend this to $150 until the morning. She spoke to her manager and came back and was able to do that. I have to say that Kate was extremely pleasant in what could have been an embarrassing situation for me. I mentioned that the $300 hold was not on my reservation or any paperwork and she apologized for that. Nothing was her fault and she handled it well. However, I believe that the hotel should let a guest know the hold beforehand, as $300 is a steeper amount than customary, especially when the room is fully paid for in advance. It made my first 1/2 hour in the hotel very uncomfortable. After that, besides the non-music hotel noise, I had a great time. I hope to visit this hotel again in the future. I did not get to enjoy the restaurant, but would love to on a future visit. It looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Felt totally unwelcome.”
Reviews.Author: skip-parker
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me begin by saying that i am a seasoned traveler for both work and pleasure. And i have never felt so unwelcome and unwanted at a hotel than at the Mondrian Soho. The hotel is a beautiful, hip, cool-looking hotel in a great location. So when I could get a great rate for a weekend when I had to be in New York for a wedding, i jumped at it. Don't make the same mistake that I did. Yes, it's true, the place looks great. And the rooms, which are tiny, are efficient and nicely appointed and comfortable. But if you want room service, food at the restaurant, drinks at the bar or -- G-D FORBID -- A CAB -- forget about it. What you will get is a total disregard for your happiness or satisfaction. Your room service order: it won't arrive. The woman who took your order never told anyone or wrote it down or remembers you calling. And she won't apologize. She'll act like it's your fault. I actually walked down to the bar and got a pot of coffee, a tray, two cups and carried to to my room on my own. If i had left it to them, I'd still be waiting for coffee. Food at the restaurant? That depends. They don't serve between 3 and 5 pm. So no snacks after you've gone shopping. Of course, some staff will say that they have food. Others won't. The truth is: no food between 3 and 5. How convenient. Drinks at the bar? Hmmm. Let's see, you won't even get the hip waiters to even pay attention to you, so you're not getting a drink. But they may walk by and say, "I'll be with you," and never come back. That will happen, for sure. Want a cab? You're not getting one with this location. The doormen, who may be the only slightly helpful staff at all, tried in vain to flag down a cab for me. But this location does not lend itself to getting a cab. Allow yourself 30 minutes to try and get a cab. Seriously. It took me 30 minutes on a Saturday night at 7. In nice weather. When I checked out, I very nicely told the front desk that I didn't appreciate how their staff gave me misinformation and made feel so unwelcome. The woman, suddenly acting friendly, regurgitated an apology. My advice: don't go there. Unless you want to see the most-depressing, dark, dank workout room ever built in a windowless basement. A down on his luck Rocky Balboa wouldn't have worked out there.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever.”
Reviews.Author: katherinett
Reviews.Content: I arrived in the afternoon, had to shower and hurry out for a function, and called downstairs to ask for a shower cap. "We don't have shower caps," I was told by Kate at the front desk, "but you can go down the street to Duane Reade and get one." It was freezing rain outside. (The correct response would have been, "Let me have someone run out and get you one." Also, what hotel doesn't stock shower caps? In the 4 days I stayed, the very heavy front door was held open for me once. There is no room service after midnight, and you can't get anything to eat in the hotel lobby between 3.30 and 5.30. The general attitude of the service staff is disinterested and lazy. The bedding is cushy, but you can't sleep for the constant thumping of the house music through 4am.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lexon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with my 14 year old daughter-explored SOHo and had a great time-Much more relaxing than staying in mid-town-Plan to stay here on my next visit to NYC-Everything was perfect

Reviews.Title: “interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snodgrass999
Reviews.Content: Loved the overall look and feel of the hotel.....Its not that easy to find but it is an easy walk from the subway. We waited in the restaurant/bar for our room (available at 3 ) the service was very good and enthusiastic. Now the not so good part, we went upstairs to get our key at 3 and the young man at the desk did not even look at us. We waited and waited until finally I said " can you please help us or at least call someone who can. He briefly looked up and went back to his typing. He then called through a door and a young lady came out to help. This entire process took over 15 min. There were no other guests in the lobby at the time. We went up to our room, it was clean, white and fun (no issues there).We did not have a problem with noise like in other reviews (15th Floor) I have to mention that the elevator is a little to dark and moody, You really cant see who is in there with you. Maybe that's the point ! I dont know! Finally, breakfast was great, and the service was perfect "Eduardo" was our waiter. If hotel management read this, hold onto that guy he is great.......an asset

Reviews.Title: “Overall...great experience”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaJ51
Reviews.Content: I recently celebrated my 60th birthday with a trip to NYC and a stay at the Mondrian SoHo. I was very excited to discover the hotel and to book the weekend at a very good introductory rate. I was enticed by the press that I read and by the whole experience of being at a hotel during its opening weeks. I have to say that, overall, I was not disappointed. The vine-covered entry way and outdoor "courtyard" were very welcoming. The funky, artsy blue and white decor of the lobby was quite unique. It was little confusing getting to the front desk (located on the second floor), and we started up the stairs with our luggage in tow, as we were unaware of the location of the elevator. But an employee quickly assisted me in carrying it up the stairs. We arrived from the airport at 1:30, but could not check in earlier than 3:00. The management did, however, store our luggage as we wandered around the area. (The location is great! I much prefer the little shops and restaurants in this part of the city to midtown.) When we got to the room, I was definitely impressed with the cleanliness and comfort...and, yes, with the ipad! The pillows are absolutely the best pillows I have ever had in a hotel! On the issue of noisiness, I had read reviews complaining about the "thin walls." So we mentioned to the desk upon check-in that I was a light sleeper, so we got a room on the 23rd floor. We had no issue with noise, and the view was astounding! During our stay we experienced both the bar and restaurant. Though not inexpensive, both were excellent! And kudos to the bartender on Sunday morning...great guy! Actually, all of the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. But, there were a couple of glitches: it took quite a while for us to get our luggage after checking into the room. We actually had to call to track it down. There needs to be some more specific written directions in each room as to how to operate the ipod dock and the ipad. The tap water had a strange milky appearance...the hotel needs to provide bottled-water for no cost. We had a leak from under the sink and called the front desk. No one ever showed up to look into it. And the night club-like atmosphere in the bar and lobby at night was a little intimidating for those of us who are far beyond being 30 somethings! But, all in all, I would recommend this hotel. The management seems responsive to working on the glitches. The Mondrian SoHo is on its way to being a fine hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you actually want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: kategem
Reviews.Content: I'm not a precious traveller. I swear I'm not. But when you can hear every cough, footstep, door opening, door closing and elevator ping that happens, ALL NIGHT LONG, then you tend to get a little fed up. This hotel isn't soundproofed. At all. Maybe the good reviews, below, are from people who stayed before the hotel was full. Because if there's more than one person on the floor, it's ridiculous. And the elevator ping is way too loud. My room was the furtherest away from the elevator yet every time it arrived, I heard it. A doubleping. When you're standing next to it, it's geniunely deafening. Room service arrived promptly - food was middling, a 'main' salad was the size of a side, arrived without any bread or anything like that. The people are young, goodloooking, charming - but you can get that at any Soho hotel. And the room is tiny, cold, and beautiful. All in all, this place is severely style over substance. Why someone would build a potentially beautiful hotel and then give it the soundproofing qualities of an open hospital ward is beyond me.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Experiance”
Reviews.Author: cam516
Reviews.Content: I must stay, being a long-time resident of the city, that the service we received was absolutely amazing. My wife and I spent the weekend at the Mondrian for a little "staycation" and had a marvelous time. Wilson, thank you for the hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Room Discrepancies and Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: zonainhi
Reviews.Content: Terrible overall experience. My girlfriend and I stayed at the hotel for one night and used the restaurant for a nice meal; the total cost was $700+. For that price, you would expect the phones to work (they didn't), room service (there was none), free internet (you pay for it), and flawless AC/heating (the unit is loud). You would also expect the valet to not leave your car unattended on the street with the keys inside (he did). Lastly, you would expect the staff to knock before entering your room (they did not, and a security worker walked in on my girlfriend and I while we were completely disrobed and being intimate). How did the hotel show concern for my horrible experience? 10% off the room price only (a $28 discount on my $700+ bill) and failing to return my emails. Give your money to somebody else; this place is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: pacha23
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in a Superior King and experienced all the beauty and not the beast. Location: just perfect! Although the Crosby Street entrance was temporarily closed due to improvements. Our check-in with Dean was very professional and friendly. Our room was available at 1:00 pm. Room: gorgeous with a fabulous city view, including the Empire state building. I loved the blue and white design with all the mirrors, especially the blue one. The bed was just great. Very stylish and functional details, such as the wardrobe space or the shower. A fresh orchid and great bathroom amentities by Malin Goetz. We even got the Mondrian Soho cupcake. Although the hotel seemed quite booked and there were neighbours in the rooms next to us, we weren't bothered by and noise. Excellent room service - there were even check-ups wether the rooms were done properly - nobody should complain that they don't try to improve. And if you ran into service employees on the floor they were always very friendly and helpful. A request at the front desk was fulfilled within 25 minutes. Public spaces: simply stunning and beautiful with extraordinary design, although you sometimes need to get used to the darkness, especially in the elevators (but they turned up to the lighting). Check-out was quick and friendly, too and we got a late check-out. I can only recommend the Mondrian Soho, as I had a wonderful stay and I can't wait to come back there when I'm next time in New York...

Reviews.Title: “Yikes”
Reviews.Author: Britboyscott
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. Of course all the trendiness we expect from the brand. I was on a low floor and the roadworks disurbed me. They have a great guest experience manager who moved me after front desk said I had to pay a surcharge to move to a suite. Room was good, but unfortunately the reviews I'd read about the thin walls eventuated. I have to say that hearing people having sex is quite revolting to me. How on earth can people who design hotels let this happen. Tomorrow moving to Murray Hill for the rest of my 2 week stay

Reviews.Title: “Shocking Customer Service Before I have even stepped into the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: u586148
Reviews.Content: I have recently got engaged and have been looking for a place to hold the wedding, after viewing the website and reading reviews we were very interested in viewing the Mondrian Hotel in Soho. HOWEVER.. it has now been four days attempting to actually speak to someone so I have now given up! I have left numerous voicemails and actually spoken to two people who have taken my contacts details but the promise of someone calling me back has not materialized. Now as I have never been in the hotel I am unable to speak for the service recieved whilst staying there but if this is an indication of the service being given considering the money I am willing to spend I would stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NEW STANDARD IN SOHO”
Reviews.Author: interestingvibe
Reviews.Content: Soho has always been cool, but with the addition of the Mondrian it is now not only cool but chic, comfortable, and service oriented. I enjoyed 3 days of bliss on crosby, great room, great bar, and great service. What I find amazing is that the hotel has been open for a week. I cant wait to go back after a month or a year. Congrats to morgans hotels for another rocking destination. My favorite is Delano but in NYC Mondrian will be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy decor but very thin walls”
Reviews.Author: eliztravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last night with spouse. NIce common areas ; trendy decor. Bar very busy at midnight. Room small and clean. Had a superior king room on 7th floor which had a door to an adjoining room - every sound from next door could be heard especially the loud, expletive ridden rant the occupant choose to give at 3 am. Normal level conversation also could be clearly heard as could shower, tv, hairdryer. Didn't make for a good nights sleep. Had pleasant lunch in restaurant - food nice and well presented. I pointed out to our server that ours and several other tables had the silverware set incorrectly - knife and fork reversed and glass on wrong side - he barely acknowledged this and did nothing to change any of the other tables. Very unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: amkaur
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mondiran SoHo for 4night from March 4th. On arriving my check-in was smooth and very quick. I stayed on the 5th floor which still had pretty decent views of the city. My room was big enough and the bathroom was very large too, the room was amazing in the quality of the fittings and the bed was way too comfy! I had no problems with thin walls or noise from anyone else. The best bit about the hotel for me was Imperial No. Nine. Breakfast everyday was lovely! The staff at the bar were 1st class and so friendly, by the end of my stay the all the bar staff and security knew me by first name and would always stop to have a chat with me. It felt like chatting to friends, the hotel ahs a very personal touch and this shows in all the staff! I have been a Morgan's hotel junkie for a few years and i have to say this is the best hotel i have stayed in. I can't wait to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A Treat”
Reviews.Author: cybee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mondrian Soho the first Friday they were open, so it was still well within the soft opening time frame and thus there were some initial kinks. Our room was not ready (turned out to be trashed by prior client) so we were upgraded to a double double room which also was not ready. No matter, we went to eat at Balthazar as the room was readied (Good resto not far from this hotel). Alas, the room was still not ready when we returned. Once we did have our room, we so enjoyed our stay! Now, keep in mind there is no sign in the front. It is a lovely vined front and while not fully completed when we were there, there is now an arched vined walkway in to the front door ( a "verdant entryway"). We were met greeted at the front door (Crosby Street) by a young fellow who took our bags and advised us to go up the stairs to the second floor to check in. As we entered the main floor, it was a delight to see the large blue chairs and artsy set up with fun Dr. Suessesque fluffy tall lamps. Of course, this is to channel the early (non-Disney) Beauty and the Beast movie. Thus one could describe some of the chairs as large enough for a beast but lovely enough for a beauty! Up the stairs we went, and Shawn (Sean) was a very gracious and friendly staff member who did the best to accommodate us as we checked in despite the problems of room availability due to previous late staying (and errant) guests. Once in our room, I was delighted again with the decor of white, blue and chrome! The pillows with the blue design are such a lovely accent. The view from our window was absolutely great! Yes, you do have a free iPad in your room (don't lose/take it...will cost you dearly!). The shower was great and the beds most comfy! We found our room to be quiet. In the morning we were delighted to have a free continental breakfast since it was soft opening time and Imperial 9 (the restaurant) was not open yet (opened March 1, I believe). We were most pleased with the food and decor of Imperial 9! I sat on a pretty golden benchette and I noted there were tastefully done "fish scaled" walls. Truly would love to go again! It had kinks to work out during the soft opening but despite that bumpy start, it was a true treat to stay at the Mondrian Soho.

Reviews.Title: “small, loud and trendy”
Reviews.Author: atravelergal
Reviews.Content: The new hotel has a great design from the street and lobby but the rooms are small- extremely loud (from neighbors and street noise- you can hear a conversation down the hall and the subway). The staff seems to be struggling- we saw several people changing rooms and complaining at the front desk. The room and bathroom were very small. The views were great and the location was convenient. Probably best to go for a drink at the hotel and not to stay overnight. I am not planning on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. Great Location. Brilliant Staff”
Reviews.Author: M4RKM
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say. I stayed here for one night, in room 406. View looked out on a courtyard, and another building, but those windows are something amazing, and let so much natural light into the room. It's better than my own bedroom back home. It is still in a soft opening stage, so I can forgive them for an empty mini bar, but the amenities in the room, loads of towels, amazing toiletries, and one of the best showers I've ever experienced easily made up for it. Then there is the bed. Sprung Mattress, plus memory foam topper on it, luxurious pillows, and numerous scatter cushions just made it amazing to sleep on. Solid sleep and I'm missing that bed already. I didn't hear any issues with walls, even in the morning. Maybe someone else heard my music, using the in room iPod Dock turned up loud, but, some of the previous reviews just seem a bit over the top, c'mon, what hotel or even house for that matter doesn't have "thin" walls. Then there is the staff. Upon check in, and check out, and any dealings I had with the staff, they're so enthusiastic about the hotel, its surroundings, and the amenities, including a demonstration on the in room iPad, (which saved money, as I didn't have to pay for WiFi for the laptop), just made me feel so welcome as a solo traveller, staying for 1 night on a bargain rate. They're obviously trained well, and love their job, which shows. I can see this hotel getting better once all the niggles and the main entrance being finally open, and everything is perfected. It oozes style, and is aiming at a younger crowd. If you want cheaper, stay at the HI down the road, but it won't be the same experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great for just opening up!”
Reviews.Author: neiko1
Reviews.Content: This hotel had just opened 2 days prior to our arrival, I have to say I was a little taken back and didn't know what to expect. Honestly, they did a great job! A few little thing that needed attention but nothing major and they handled everything quickly. Beautiful decor, hip, chic, all the cool stuff you would expect in Soho. Best bed and linen and the views were the best in NYC. We are use to a little larger room with a tub, but what you give up is size you get back in comfort and views. Congratulations to the staff, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Elegance”
Reviews.Author: cwaisner
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on a nice quiet street, just 2 blocks from the hustle and crowds of Soho, the garden entrance leads you into an elaborate and most beautifully colored and soothing lobby giving you a sense of peace, yet the surroundings are similar to other sister hotels. From the seating to lighting, and burst of colors, you already feel at home before you take the elvator to the 2nd floor lobby. Everyone was supper friendly and helpful and once we checked in, we felt like we were at home. The sleeping and seating areas were wonderfully appointed and comfy. Also loved the spacious bathroom, probably the most powerful showerhead in the world! Plenty of storage space yet the room never felt crowded or small. From the 23rd floor, i felt like like i was on top of the world. Would I go back, in a second. I highly recommend it and am planning my next trip already.

Reviews.Title: “great if you like "sharing" your room with complete strangers......”
Reviews.Author: vilany1982
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the visuals to mesmerize you at first and make you believe that you are staying in an "IT" hotel. We were as delighted as we could be until we realized that we were "sharing the room" with somebody else. Somebody has mentioned thin walls in the other reviews but that does not even start to describe it for me...we heard everything and i MEAN EVERYTHING WE were pretty much in the same room WITH THE PEOPLE NEXT DOOR......making the trip completely miserable ...... You are forced to live on somebody else's schedule when they are ready to go to bed you CAN finally relax too......oh but wait not so fast the windows are so thin you are lucky if you are able to get ANY REST!!!!!!!!!! Listening to people watching adult movies and being intimate at 1 o'clock in the morning is extremely unpleasant ....i have stayed in rooms that opened to each other before BUT NEVER IN ONE THIS POORLY CONSTRUCTED!!!!!!!!!!! WOULD NOT RECOMMEND WHAT SO EVER!!! OR LET ME REPHRASE : DONT GET A ROOM THAT OPENS UP TO ANOTHER ROOM!!!!!!(if that is possible) I honestly could not even focus on anything else in the hotel, i hated returning to our room i hated the place!!!!!!
